commit_message:
INFINIDAT add Manila driver

Adding basic driver version for the INFINIDAT Infinibox storage array.

Change-Id: I8299915a12b51c80a044f41ceb7a49da32745272
Implements: blueprint infinidat-manila-driver
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/32/515432/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Infinidat Ltd. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ INFINIDAT InfiniBox Share Driver """ import functools from itertools import izip import netaddr from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_utils import units from manila.common import constants from manila import exception from manila.i18n import _ from manila.share import driver from manila import version try: import capacity import infinisdk except ImportError: capacity = None infinisdk = None LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) infinidat_connection_opts = [ cfg.HostAddressOpt('infinibox_hostname', help='The name (or IP address) for the INFINIDAT ' 'Infinibox storage system.'), ] infinidat_auth_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('infinibox_login', help=('Administrative user account name used to access the ' 'INFINIDAT Infinibox storage system.')), cfg.StrOpt('infinibox_password', help=('Password for the administrative user account ' 'specified in the infinibox_login option.'), secret=True), ] infinidat_general_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('infinidat_pool_name', help='Name of the pool from which volumes are allocated'), ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(infinidat_connection_opts) CONF.register_opts(infinidat_auth_opts) CONF.register_opts(infinidat_general_opts) _MANILA_TO_INFINIDAT_ACCESS_LEVEL = { constants.ACCESS_LEVEL_RW: 'RW', constants.ACCESS_LEVEL_RO: 'RO', } def infinisdk_to_manila_exceptions(func): @functools.wraps(func) def wrapper(*args, **kwargs): try: return func(*args, **kwargs) except infinisdk.core.exceptions.InfiniSDKException as ex: if ex.error_code == 'POOL_VIRTUAL_CAPACITY': raise exception.ShareSizeExceedsAvailableQuota() # string formatting of 'ex' includes http code and url msg = _('Caught exception from infinisdk: %s') % ex LOG.exception(msg) raise exception.ShareBackendException(msg=msg) return wrapper class InfiniboxShareDriver(driver.ShareDriver): VERSION = '1.0' # driver version def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(InfiniboxShareDriver, self).__init__(False, *args, **kwargs) self.configuration.append_config_values(infinidat_connection_opts) self.configuration.append_config_values(infinidat_auth_opts) self.configuration.append_config_values(infinidat_general_opts) def do_setup(self, context): """Driver initialization""" if infinisdk is None: msg = _("Missing 'infinisdk' python module, ensure the library" " is installed and available.") raise exception.ManilaException(message=msg) auth = (self.configuration.infinibox_login, self.configuration.infinibox_password) self.management_address = self.configuration.infinibox_hostname self._system = infinisdk.InfiniBox(self.management_address, auth=auth) self._system.login() backend_name = self.configuration.safe_get('share_backend_name') self._backend_name = backend_name or self.__class__.__name__ LOG.debug('setup complete') def _update_share_stats(self): """Retrieve stats info from share group.""" free_capacity_bytes, physical_capacity_bytes = \ self._get_available_capacity() data = dict( share_backend_name=self._backend_name, driver_handles_share_servers=False, vendor_name='INFINIDAT', driver_version=self.VERSION, storage_protocol='NFS', total_capacity_gb=float(physical_capacity_bytes) / units.Gi, free_capacity_gb=float(free_capacity_bytes) / units.Gi, reserved_percentage=self.configuration.reserved_share_percentage, snapshot_support=True, create_share_from_snapshot_support=True, mount_snapshot_support=True, revert_to_snapshot_support=True) super(InfiniboxShareDriver, self)._update_share_stats(data) def _get_available_capacity(self): pool = self._get_infinidat_pool() free_capacity_bytes = (pool.get_free_physical_capacity() / capacity.byte) physical_capacity_bytes = (pool.get_physical_capacity() / capacity.byte) return free_capacity_bytes, physical_capacity_bytes def _make_share_name(self, manila_share): return 'openstack-shr-%s' % manila_share.id def _make_snapshot_name(self, manila_snapshot): return 'openstack-snap-%s' % manila_snapshot['id'] def _set_manila_object_metadata(self, infinidat_object, manila_object): data = dict(system="openstack", openstack_version=version.version_info.release_string(), manila_id=manila_object['id'], manila_name=manila_object['name']) infinidat_object.set_metadata_from_dict(data) @infinisdk_to_manila_exceptions def _get_infinidat_pool(self): pool_name = self.configuration.infinidat_pool_name if pool_name is None: msg = _('infinidat_pool_name parameter was not defined') LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadConfigurationException(msg) pool = self._system.pools.safe_get(name=pool_name) if pool is None: msg = _('Pool "%s" not found') % pool_name LOG.error(msg) raise exception.ShareBackendException(message=msg) return pool @infinisdk_to_manila_exceptions def _get_infinidat_filesystem_by_name(self, name): filesystem = self._system.filesystems.safe_get(name=name) if filesystem is None: raise exception.ShareNotFound(share_id=name) return filesystem def _get_infinidat_filesystem(self, manila_share): filesystem_name = self._make_share_name(manila_share) return self._get_infinidat_filesystem_by_name(filesystem_name) def _get_infinidat_snapshot_by_name(self, name): snapshot = self._system.filesystems.safe_get(name=name) if snapshot is None: raise exception.ShareSnapshotNotFound(snapshot_id=name) return snapshot def _get_infinidat_snapshot(self, manila_snapshot): snapshot_name = self._make_snapshot_name(manila_snapshot) return self._get_infinidat_snapshot_by_name(snapshot_name) def _get_infinidat_dataset(self, manila_object, is_snapshot): return (self._get_infinidat_snapshot(manila_object) if is_snapshot else self._get_infinidat_filesystem(manila_object)) @infinisdk_to_manila_exceptions def _get_export(self, infinidat_filesystem): infinidat_exports = infinidat_filesystem.get_exports() if len(infinidat_exports) == 0: msg = _("Could not find share export") raise exception.InvalidShareAccess(msg) elif len(infinidat_exports) > 1: msg = _("INFINIDAT filesystem has more than one active export; " "possibly not a Manila share") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.InvalidShareInstance(msg) return infinidat_exports[0] def _get_infinidat_access_level(self, access): """Translates between Manila access levels to INFINIDAT API ones""" access_level = access['access_level'] if access_level in _MANILA_TO_INFINIDAT_ACCESS_LEVEL: return _MANILA_TO_INFINIDAT_ACCESS_LEVEL[access_level] msg = _('Invalid share access level "%s"') % access_level raise exception.InvalidShareAccessLevel(msg) def _get_ip_address_range(self, ip_address): """Parse single IP address or subnet into a range. If the IP address string is in subnet mask format, returns a <start ip>-<end-ip> string. If the IP address contains a single IP address, returns only that IP address. """ import ipaddress import six ip_address = six.text_type(ip_address) try: # try treating the ip_address parameter as a single IP address: ipaddress.ip_address(ip_address) return ip_address except (ValueError, ipaddress.AddressValueError): # try treating the ip_address parameter as a range of IP addresses: ip_network = ipaddress.ip_network(ip_address, strict=False) ip_network_hosts = list(ip_network.hosts()) if len(ip_network_hosts) == 0: # /32 return ip_address.split('/')[0] return "{}-{}".format(ip_network_hosts[0], ip_network_hosts[-1]) raise ValueError("Invalid parameter %s" % ip_address) def _to_network_object(self, client): ip_range = client.split('-') return netaddr.IPRange(ip_range[0], ip_range[-1]) def _network_intersection(self, first_network, second_network): return (set(self._to_network_object(first_network)) & set(self._to_network_object(second_network))) def _get_new_permission_clients(self, original_permission_client, denied_client): intersection = self._network_intersection( original_permission_client, denied_client) complement = sorted( set(self._to_network_object(original_permission_client)) ^ intersection) if len(complement) == 1: yield complement[0] ip_diff = [first_ip - second_ip for first_ip, second_ip in izip(complement[1:], complement[:-1])] indices = [index for index, ip in enumerate(ip_diff) if ip != netaddr.IPAddress('0.0.0.1')] indices = [-1] + indices + [-1] for start_index, end_index in izip(indices[:-1], indices[1:]): yield '%s-%s' % (complement[start_index + 1], complement[end_index]) def _get_new_permissions(self, permissions, ip_address, allow, access): new_permissions = [] # permission.client is in the Infinibox format (single IP or a # range XX.XX.XX.XX-YY.YY.YY.YY) whereas ip_address (the # permission) we need to check is in the Manila format (single IP # or a subnet XX.XX.XX.XX/XX) ip_address_range = self._get_ip_address_range(ip_address) for permission in permissions: permission_dict = self._create_permission_dict( access=permission.access, client=permission.client) if allow: new_permissions.append(permission_dict) continue # handling the case where we need to add a deny permission. # Either find an existing permission client which # matches exactly the IP address to be denied access, and # remove that from the permission list, or see if the IP # address or range is included in the IP range of one of the # existing permissions. In the second case, remove the IP # address from that range and rebuild the permission object: if permission.client == ip_address_range: continue elif self._network_intersection(permission.client, ip_address_range): for client in ( self._get_new_permission_clients( permission.client, ip_address_range)): new_permissions.append( self._create_permission_dict( access=permission.access, client=client)) else: new_permissions.append(permission_dict) return new_permissions def _create_permission_dict(self, access, client): return {'access': access, 'client': client, 'no_root_squash': True} @infinisdk_to_manila_exceptions def _set_access(self, infinidat_export, access, allow): """Set a single access rule (permission) to a filesystem export""" permissions = infinidat_export.get_permissions() infinidat_access_level = self._get_infinidat_access_level(access) if allow: return infinidat_export.update_permissions( permissions + [self._create_permission_dict( access=infinidat_access_level, client=self._get_ip_address_range(access['access_to']))]) infinidat_export.update_permissions( self._get_new_permissions( permissions=permissions, ip_address=access['access_to'], allow=allow, access=infinidat_access_level)) def _create_filesystem_export(self, infinidat_filesystem): infinidat_export = infinidat_filesystem.add_export(permissions=[]) return { 'path': infinidat_export.get_export_path(), 'is_admin_only': False, 'metadata': {}, } @infinisdk_to_manila_exceptions def _delete_share(self, share, is_snapshot): if is_snapshot: share_name = self._make_snapshot_name(share) else: share_name = self._make_share_name(share) try: infinidat_filesystem = ( self._get_infinidat_filesystem_by_name(share_name)) except exception.ShareNotFound: return # filesystem not found if infinidat_filesystem.has_children(): # can't delete a filesystem that has a live snapshot if is_snapshot: raise exception.ShareSnapshotIsBusy(snapshot_name=share_name) else: raise exception.ShareBusyException(reason=share_name) try: infinidat_export = self._get_export(infinidat_filesystem) except exception.InvalidShareAccess: # it possible that the export has been deleted pass else: infinidat_export.safe_delete() infinidat_filesystem.safe_delete() @infinisdk_to_manila_exceptions def _extend_share(self, infinidat_filesystem, new_size): new_size_capacity_units = new_size * capacity.GiB old_size = infinidat_filesystem.get_size() if new_size_capacity_units > old_size: infinidat_filesystem.resize(new_size_capacity_units - old_size) elif new_size_capacity_units < old_size: raise exception.ShareShrinkingError(_( "INFINIDAT Infinibox API does not allow dataset shrinking")) @infinisdk_to_manila_exceptions def _update_access(self, manila_object, access_rules, is_snapshot): infinidat_filesystem = self._get_infinidat_dataset( manila_object, is_snapshot=is_snapshot) infinidat_export = self._get_export(infinidat_filesystem) if is_snapshot: # snapshots are to be mounted in read-only mode, see: # "Add mountable snapshots" on openstack specs. access = ( _MANILA_TO_INFINIDAT_ACCESS_LEVEL[constants.ACCESS_LEVEL_RO]) permissions = [ {'access': access, 'client': self._get_ip_address_range( access_rule['access_to']), 'no_root_squash': True} for access_rule in access_rules] else: permissions = [ {'access': self._get_infinidat_access_level(access_rule), 'client': self._get_ip_address_range( access_rule['access_to']), 'no_root_squash': True} for access_rule in access_rules] infinidat_export.update_permissions(permissions) @infinisdk_to_manila_exceptions def create_share(self, context, share, share_server=None): pool = self._get_infinidat_pool() size = share.size * capacity.GiB share_name = self._make_share_name(share) infinidat_filesystem = self._system.filesystems.create( pool=pool, name=share_name, size=size) self._set_manila_object_metadata(infinidat_filesystem, share) return self._create_filesystem_export(infinidat_filesystem) @infinisdk_to_manila_exceptions def create_share_from_snapshot(self, context, share, snapshot, share_server=None): if share.size < snapshot.size: message = _("New share size %(share_size)f is smaller than " "the original snapshot size %(snapshot_size)f") raise exception.ShareBackendException( message, {'share_size': share.size, 'snapshot_size': snapshot.size}) name = self._make_share_name(share) infinidat_snapshot = self._get_infinidat_snapshot(snapshot) infinidat_new_share = infinidat_snapshot.create_child( name=name, write_protected=False) self._extend_share(infinidat_new_share, share.size) return self._create_filesystem_export(infinidat_new_share) @infinisdk_to_manila_exceptions def create_snapshot(self, context, snapshot, share_server=None): """Creates a snapshot.""" share = snapshot['share'] if snapshot.size < share.size: message = _("New snapshot size %(snapshot_size)f is smaller than " "the original share size %(share_size)f") raise exception.ShareBackendException( message, {'snapshot_size': snapshot.size, 'share_size': share.size}) infinidat_filesystem = self._get_infinidat_filesystem(share) name = self._make_snapshot_name(snapshot) infinidat_snapshot = infinidat_filesystem.create_child(name=name) self._extend_share(infinidat_snapshot, snapshot.size) self._set_manila_object_metadata(infinidat_snapshot, snapshot) return {'export_locations': [self._create_filesystem_export(infinidat_snapshot)]} def delete_share(self, context, share, share_server=None): self._delete_share(share, is_snapshot=False) def delete_snapshot(self, context, snapshot, share_server=None): self._delete_share(snapshot, is_snapshot=True) def get_pool(self, share): # We only have one pool for OpenStack on the system, and it is # set in the configuration. We use _get_infinidat_pool and not the # config parameter (infinidat_pool_name) directly in order to make # sure the pool actually exists in the backend. return self._get_infinidat_pool().get_name() def ensure_share(self, context, share, share_server=None): infinidat_filesystem = self._get_infinidat_filesystem(share) try: infinidat_export = self._get_export(infinidat_filesystem) except exception.InvalidShareAccess: # export not found, need to re-export message = _("missing export for share %(share)s, " "trying to re-export") LOG.info(message, {"share": share}) infinidat_export = ( self._create_filesystem_export(infinidat_filesystem)) return [infinidat_export.get_export_path()] def allow_access(self, context, share, access, share_server=None): infinidat_filesystem = self._get_infinidat_filesystem(share) infinidat_export = self._get_export(infinidat_filesystem) self._set_access(infinidat_export, access, allow=True) def deny_access(self, context, share, access, share_server=None): infinidat_filesystem = self._get_infinidat_filesystem(share) infinidat_export = self._get_export(infinidat_filesystem) self._set_access(infinidat_export, access, allow=False) def update_access(self, context, share, access_rules, add_rules, delete_rules, share_server=None): # As the Infinibox API can bulk update export access rules, we will try # to use the access_rules list self._update_access(share, access_rules, is_snapshot=False) def get_network_allocations_number(self): return 0 def manage_existing(self, share, driver_options): raise NotImplementedError("This feature is currently not supported " "by the INFINIDAT Infinibox share driver") def manage_existing_snapshot(self, snapshot, driver_options): raise NotImplementedError("This feature is currently not supported " "by the INFINIDAT Infinibox share driver") def revert_to_snapshot(self, context, snapshot, access_rules, share_server=None): infinidat_snapshot = self._get_infinidat_snapshot(snapshot) infinidat_parent_share = self._get_infinidat_filesystem( snapshot['share']) infinidat_parent_share.restore(infinidat_snapshot) def extend_share(self, share, new_size, share_server=None): infinidat_filesystem = self._get_infinidat_filesystem(share) self._extend_share(infinidat_filesystem, new_size) def shrink_share(self, share, new_size, share_server=None): raise exception.ShareShrinkingPossibleDataLoss(share_id=share['id']) def snapshot_update_access(self, context, snapshot, access_rules, add_rules, delete_rules, share_server=None): self._update_access(snapshot, access_rules, is_snapshot=True)

commit_message:
VMware: Factor out relocate_vm()

VM relocation is not volume specific operation and should be moved to
vm_util.py

Change-Id: Ic129a8da2b3e6eed3635f3d8b07f32a60ec9d8e3
(cherry picked from commit 766d13218763f43ba91c2a15adff438a0dd84e37)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/49/526549/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def relocate_vm_spec(client_factory, res_pool=None, datastore=None, host=None, disk_move_type="moveAllDiskBackingsAndAllowSharing"): rel_spec.host = host rel_spec.pool = res_pooldef relocate_vm(session, vm_ref, res_pool=None, datastore=None, host=None, disk_move_type="moveAllDiskBackingsAndAllowSharing"): client_factory = session.vim.client.factory rel_spec = relocate_vm_spec(client_factory, res_pool, datastore, host, disk_move_type) relocate_task = session._call_method(session.vim, "RelocateVM_Task", vm_ref, spec=rel_spec) session._wait_for_task(relocate_task)
deleted_lines: def relocate_vm_spec(client_factory, datastore=None, host=None, disk_move_type="moveAllDiskBackingsAndAllowSharing"): """Builds the VM relocation spec.""" if host: rel_spec.host = host

commit_message:
Ceilosca pagination hanging problem

If enable_api_pagination is turned on
ceilometer statistics api call with group by
did not return any results. This review fixes
problem with indentation. Also fixing similar
problems with metric_list and measurement list
calls in monasca client.
Also added unit tests to test metrics list,
measurement list and statistics list when
pagination is enabled and also when disabled.

Change-Id: I2394da8c0c32d8516ac8136fcaaef87e546966b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-ceilometer refs/changes/38/526238/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # enable monasca api pagination # check if api pagination is enabled # offset for metrics is the last metric's id search_args['offset'] = metric['id'] metrics = self.call_func(self._mon_client.metrics.list, **search_args) # check if api pagination is enabled # offset for measurements is measurement id composited with # the last measurement's timestamp search_args['offset'] = '%s_%s' % ( measurement['id'], measurement['measurements'][-1][0]) measurements = self.call_func( self._mon_client.metrics.list_measurements, **search_args) # check if api pagination is enabled # with groupby, the offset is unpredictable to me, we don't # support pagination for it now. if kwargs.get('group_by'): break # offset for statistics is statistic id composited with # the last statistic's timestamp search_args['offset'] = '%s_%s' % ( statistic['id'], statistic['statistics'][-1][0]) statistics = self.call_func( self._mon_client.metrics.list_statistics, **search_args) # unlike metrics.list and metrics.list_measurements # return whole new data, metrics.list_statistics # next page will use last page's final statistic # data as the first one, so we need to pop it here. # I think Monasca should treat this as a bug and fix it. if statistics: statistics[0]['statistics'].pop(0) if len(statistics[0]['statistics']) == 0: statistics.pop(0)
deleted_lines: # nable monasca api pagination # check of api pagination is enabled # offset for metircs is the last metric's id search_args['offset'] = metric['id'] metrics = self.call_func(self._mon_client.metrics.list, **search_args) # check of api pagination is enabled # offset for measurements is measurement id composited with # the last measurement's timestamp search_args['offset'] = '%s_%s' % ( measurement['id'], measurement['measurements'][-1][0]) measurements = self.call_func( self._mon_client.metrics.list_measurements, **search_args) # check of api pagination is enabled # with groupby, the offset is unpredictable to me, we don't # support pagination for it now. if kwargs.get('group_by'): break # offset for statistics is statistic id composited with # the last statistic's timestamp search_args['offset'] = '%s_%s' % ( statistic['id'], statistic['statistics'][-1][0]) statistics = self.call_func( self._mon_client.metrics.list_statistics, **search_args) # unlike metrics.list and metrics.list_measurements # return whole new data, metrics.list_statistics # next page will use last page's final statistic # data as the first one, so we need to pop it here. # I think Monasca should treat this as a bug and fix it. if statistics: statistics[0]['statistics'].pop(0) if len(statistics[0]['statistics']) == 0: statistics.pop(0)

subject: Fix scaling validation error

commit_message:
Fix scaling validation error

Sahara will validate resources when running scale cluster.
But we shouldn't check all resources in node groups while scaling,
because there are some configurations for MapReduce like
'mapreduce.reduce.java.opts' in 'node_configs' which are
added after validation.
This patch changes to validate resource in "node group
template" other than "node groups".

Closes-Bug: #1736671
Change-Id: I564b07cc4db275d4a369ce8cbff87cd6bda368fa

commit_message:
Queens: Assessment for neutron-vpnaas

This patch is following up from Pike discussion [1]. With the remaining
main gap (N4) has been addressed to be able to jump into the stadium.

[1] Ie06395533211847d741c9c9bbd45bc8edbab6e5c

Change-Id: I6a8b19c8c53f49a95667af331e147b977a9d0d7c
Co-Authored-By: Armando Migliaccio <armamig@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/12/506012/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================== Neutron-vpnaas Scorecard ======================== Neutron integration ------------------- .. _N0: * N0. Does the project use the Neutron REST API or relies on proprietary backends? Yes. Neutron-vpnaas implements its own set of Neutron API extensions on top of the Neutron core framework and it does so by using the service plugin model. The API exposed has open source implementations, and it provides a pluggable mechanism for proprietary backends. .. _N1: * N1. Does the project integrate/use neutron-lib? Yes. The migration report shows that there are currently 1187 total imports. Neutron is imported 237 times and Neutron-lib 162 times, for a migration percentage of 40.6000%, .. _N2: * N2. Do project members actively contribute to help neutron-lib achieve its goal? No. None of the project core members have merged anything meaningful into neutron-lib (source: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/project:openstack/neutron-lib+status:merged,75). .. _N3: * N3. Do project members collaborate with the core team to enable subprojects to loosely integrate with the Neutron core platform by helping with the definition of modular interfaces? Yes. * https://github.com/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/7c10c41376f10898347cbc644d8d504b8258c99c .. _N4: * N4. How does the project provide networking services? Does it use modular interfaces as provided by the core platform? Yes, for the most part, but as far as the agent side is concerned, the project relies on the use of a VPN agent that specializes the base L3 agent, this is prone to breakage, and leads to deployment complications when VPN and L3 services are deployed together. This problem has been resolved. * https://github.com/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/blob/master/neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/agent.py#L46 * https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1692128 * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/488247/ .. _N5: * N5. If the project provides new API extensions, have API extensions been discussed and accepted by the Neutron drivers team? Please provide links to API specs, if required. VPNaaS API was initially created by the neutron core team, and so implicitly had been agreed upon by previous core team. Documentation ------------- .. _D1: * D1. Does the project have a doc tox target, functional and continuously working? Provide proof (links to logs.openstack.org). Yes. * https://github.com/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/blob/master/tox.ini * http://docs-draft.openstack.org/18/503118/4/check/gate-neutron-vpnaas-docs-ubuntu-xenial/cfebaa0//doc/build/html/ .. _D2: * D2. If the project provide API extensions, does the project have an api-ref tox target, functional and continously working? Provide proof (links to logs.openstack.org). Yes. There is an API reference and is being confirmed its accuracy, see: * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/447345/ * http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/ * https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/api-ref/source/v2/vpnaas.inc .. _D3: * D3. Does the project have a releasenotes tox target, functional and continously working? Provide proof. Yes. * https://github.com/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/blob/master/tox.ini * http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/neutron-vpnaas/ * http://docs-draft.openstack.org/18/503118/4/check/gate-neutron-vpnaas-releasenotes/4b1baba//releasenotes/build/html/ .. _D4: * D4. Describe the types of documentation available: developer, end user, administrator, deployer. Yes. These documentations are going to be published, see: * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/482510/ * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/446835/ * http://docs-draft.openstack.org/18/503118/4/check/gate-neutron-vpnaas-docs-ubuntu-xenial/cfebaa0//doc/build/html/ * http://docs-draft.openstack.org/10/482510/1/check/gate-neutron-docs-ubuntu-xenial/9a5a443//doc/build/html/admin/vpnaas-scenario.html Continuous Integration ---------------------- .. _C1: * C1. Does the project have a Grafana dashboard showing historical trends of all the jobs available? Provide proof (links to grafana.openstack.org). Yes. * http://grafana.openstack.org/dashboard/db/neutron-vpnaas-failure-rates .. _C2: * C2. Does the project have CI for unit coverage? Provide proof (links to logs.openstack.org) Yes. * http://status.openstack.org/openstack-health/#/g/project/openstack~2Fneutron-vpnaas .. _C3: * C3. Does the project have CI for functional coverage? If so, does it include DB migration and sync validation? Yes. We have gate-neutron-vpnaas-dsvm-functional-sswan-ubuntu-xenial for functional coverage and DB migration tests are running as a part of it. * http://status.openstack.org/openstack-health/#/job/gate-neutron-vpnaas-dsvm-functional-sswan-ubuntu-xenial .. _C4: * C4. Does the project have CI for fullstack coverage? No. We consider it as lower priority and it has none at the moment. .. _C5: * C5. Does the project have CI for Tempest coverage? If so, specify nature (API and/or Scenario). Yes. * http://logs.openstack.org/18/503118/4/check/gate-neutron-dsvm-tempest-vpnaas-ubuntu-xenial/67f21fe/testr_results.html.gz .. _C6: * C6. Does the project require CI for Grenade coverage? Yes. But it has none. .. _C7: * C7. Does the project provide multinode CI? No. But it is needed to support L3-HA (and/or DVR) and unnecessary until then. .. _C8: * C8. Does the project support Python 3.x? Provide proof. Yes. * http://status.openstack.org/openstack-health/#/job/gate-neutron-vpnaas-python35 Release footprint ----------------- .. _R1: * R1. Does the project adopt semver? Yes. .. _R2: * R2. Does the project have release deliverables? Provide proof as available in the `release repo <http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/releases/tree/>`_. Yes. * https://tarballs.openstack.org/neutron-vpnaas/neutron-vpnaas-11.0.0.tar.gz * https://pypi.python.org/pypi/neutron-vpnaas .. _R3: * R3. Does the project use upper-constraints? Yes. * https://github.com/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/blob/master/tox.ini#L10 .. _R4: * R4. Does the project integrate with OpenStack Proposal Bot for requirements updates? * Yes. * https://github.com/openstack/requirements/commit/1d545edbebfff2e8983d6cab24a92c32636dd6bf Stable backports ---------------- .. _S1: * S1. Does the project have stable branches and/or tags? Provide history of backports. Yes. For example: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/log/?h=stable/pike Client library -------------- .. _L1: * L1. If the project requires a client library, how does it implement CLI and API bindings? Yes. There are Neutron CLI and API bindings. OSC is going to be done, see: * https://review.openstack.org/#/c/439978/ Scorecard --------- +---------------+ | Scorecard | +===============+ | N0_ | Y | +---------------+ | N1_ | Y | +---------------+ | N2_ | N | +---------------+ | N3_ | Y | +---------------+ | N4_ | Y | +---------------+ | N5_ | Y | +---------------+ | D1_ | Y | +---------------+ | D2_ | Y | +---------------+ | D3_ | Y | +---------------+ | D4_ | Y | +---------------+ | C1_ | Y | +---------------+ | C2_ | Y | +---------------+ | C3_ | Y | +---------------+ | C4_ | N | +---------------+ | C5_ | Y | +---------------+ | C6_ | N | +---------------+ | C7_ | N | +---------------+ | C8_ | Y | +---------------+ | R1_ | Y | +---------------+ | R2_ | Y | +---------------+ | R3_ | Y | +---------------+ | R4_ | Y | +---------------+ | S1_ | Y | +---------------+ | L1_ | Y | +-----+---------+ Final remarks ------------- At the time of writing the project scores changed to positively if compared with the last assessment [1]_ [2]_ for following 7 criteria: N3_, N4_, D2_, D4_, C1_, C5_, L1_. It makes the project scores positively in 20 out of 24 criteria. The subproject does not seem to lack the resources recently and the remaining gaps can be focused to make timely progress when required. References ---------- .. [1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/stadium/ocata/neutron-vpnaas.html#scorecard .. [2] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/stadium/ocata.html#summary

added_lines: Windows ^^^^^^^ `Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) <https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/commandline/wsl/about>`_ is available in `Windows 10 Insider <https://insider.windows.com>`_. There is the possibility to install and run a common Linux Operating System like `Ubuntu 16.04 <https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/store/p/ubuntu/9nblggh4msv6>`_ All known tools like bash, git and ssh will work out of the box. Also helpful `Git Reference and Cheat Sheet <https://git-scm.com/doc>`_

commit_message:
Support Network Aggregate Metrics for Instance

Change-Id: I1592d49d1c1915afbb871819fe22e9b8f1479eaa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/telemetry-specs refs/changes/70/137970/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================== Support Aggregate Network Metrics for Instance ============================================== # TODO(zqfan): # register a blurprint on launchpad once the bp name is settled Instance can have mutiple VNICs, and now we have already had per VNICs metrics of:: network.incoming.bytes network.incoming.packets network.outgoing.bytes network.outgoing.packets network.incoming.bytes.rate network.outgoing.bytes.rate And there are corresponding pipelines generate rate metrics:: network.incoming.bytes.rate network.incoming.packets.rate network.outgoing.bytes.rate network.outgoing.packets.rate If we want to know the aggregate networking status of a specific instance, what I can do is: 1. ask Nova to get instance detail 2. ask Neutron to get port detail 3. combinate resource IDs for all VNICs 4. ask Ceilometer to get all samples 5. calculate those samples to get aggregate networking data It is not easy, nor natural for end users. The worst problem is that those metrics have resource ID in the form of <instance_name-instance_uuid-nic_name>, the instance name and NIC name can be changed, in such case, there is no solution to get the data I want. Problem description =================== Instance can have mutiple VNICs, and now we have already had per VNICs metrics of:: network.incoming.bytes network.incoming.packets network.outgoing.bytes network.outgoing.packets network.incoming.bytes.rate network.outgoing.bytes.rate And there are corresponding pipelines generate rate metrics:: network.incoming.bytes.rate network.incoming.packets.rate network.outgoing.bytes.rate network.outgoing.packets.rate If we want to know the aggregate networking status of a specific instance, what I can do is: 1. ask Nova to get instance detail 2. ask Neutron to get port detail 3. combinate resource IDs for all VNICs 4. ask Ceilometer to get all samples 5. calculate those samples to get aggregate networking data It is not easy, nor natural for end users. The worst problem is that those metrics have resource ID in the form of <instance_name-instance_uuid-nic_name>, the instance name and NIC name can be changed, in such case, there is no solution to get the data I want. Proposed change =============== To support the aggragate metrics, new metrics are introduced:: network.incoming.bytes.all network.outgoing.bytes.all network.incoming.packets.all network.outgoing.packets.all And corresponding rate metrics will be generated by pipeline:: network.incoming.bytes.all.rate network.outgoing.bytes.all.rate network.incoming.packets.all.rate network.outgoing.packets.all.rate To solve the resource ID issue, the per VNIC metrics will use port UUID as resource ID, and the aggragate metrics will use instance UUID as resource ID. Alternatives ------------ The existent per VNIC metrics should be renamed to:: network.nic.incoming.bytes network.nic.outgoing.bytes network.nic.incoming.packets network.nic.outgoing.packets New aggregate metrics should be named as:: network.incoming.bytes network.outgoing.bytes network.incoming.packets network.outgoing.packets This solution is the right direction we should head, because it explicitly shows that those metrics are per VNIC based. But this will have compatibility problem, so I put it in Alternatives section Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Pipeline impact --------------- rate_of_change transformer will aply to new aggregate metrics. Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance/Scalability Impacts ------------------------------- Will affect performance since new metrics are added, the compute agent, AMQP and database will be affected. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: aji-zqfan Other contributors: <launchpad-id or None> Ongoing maintainer: aji-zqfan Work Items ---------- 1. Add new aggregate metrics 2. Fix resource ID issue for per VNIC metrics Future lifecycle ================ None Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit test code will be added along with source code Documentation Impact ==================== New metrics are added, so document will need to reflect such change. References ========== 1. https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1383123

commit_message:
collect logs: remove --ansible-debug

The level of output for BM jobs in rdophase2 is far
too verbose, and is complicating debugging CI.

This commit removes --ansible-debug from collect logs
invocation

Change-Id: Idf081fe44aa9fcdf040223f71fa31915144babf4

commit_message:
Fix batching for floating ips and ports

When cache settings are in place for ports and floating ips, we should
be doing full list calls and filtering locally. This is done to prevent
things lke nodepool from crushing clouds under the weight of our immense
need for information.

Change-Id: I304ff1c0e355bcfc00398316a296417c19e9b74f

commit_message:
ironic-agent: don't remove make

It turns out make has always been a tacit dependency of openssl as it
ships a Makefile for certificates [1].  This just recently changed to
be a hard dependency in F27, so this now fails as openssl is a
dependency of protected packages such as dnf.  Since it's always been
wrong to remove it, we take it out of the purge list.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=783446

Change-Id: I69efb3a56878ab97c4587bbbf5356bea752f2846

Remove class StopWatch from timing

In new release timeutils.StopWatch can be used from oslo.uitls, so it was deprecated for removal in
timing.py

Closes-Bug: #1715043

commit_message:
Increase timeout for openstack-tox-cover job

We are seeing some timeouts in particular for Neutron patches, the usual
runtime seems to be around 25 minutes. Increase the timeout from 30
minutes (default inherited from base job) to 40 minutes, which also
matches what we had with zuul v2.

Change-Id: Id1e1b5fd88649a3af460f4a8a3f4da51c350cbec

commit_message:
Add ZooKeeper support in Vanilla cluster

This change adds the ability to deploy and manage ZooKeeper
service in vanilla. But User should be aware that you have
to deploy ZooKeeper cluster with the newest image.

Follow changes have been made to support ZooKeeper in Vanilla:
1. Open ports(2181, 2888, 3888) in SG(security group) by default;
2. Expose arguments(syncLimit, tickTime and initLimit) to manage
   ZooKeeper service;
3. Validate the node count of ZooKeeper machines to keep run an
   odd number of ZooKeeper services in cluster.

Change-Id: I846eba10eff668bb8583083b6eb884d04651418e
Partial-Implements: bp hbase-on-vanila

commit_message:
replace_six_iteritems

Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the
link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ic90b6720f1cc1011d880319d2602b663e88fbc16

commit_message:
Use assertRegex instead of assertRegexpMatches

In Python3, assertRegexpMatches & assertNotRegexpMatches
are deprecated in favor of assertRegex and assertNotRegex.

Change-Id: I273a5efb7b901996a2e80db6edadead67d2d7016

commit_message:
Add new repo for congress tempest plugin

For Queens Goal "Split Tempest Plugins into Separate Repos/Projects",
this imports from a temporary github repo that preserves the history of the
plugin and additionally applies the openstack cookiecutter to it.

Needed-By: I8e39c145541619d45919adfdcf4984489777d3ba
Change-Id: I9b6b71ba33ad66248216e452fe1817ddc2aa1697

deleted_lines: - hosts: all name: Autoconverted job legacy-osbackup-freezer-dsvm-opensuse-423 from old job gate-osbackup-freezer-dsvm-opensuse-423-nv tasks: - name: Ensure legacy workspace directory file: path: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' state: directory - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x cat > clonemap.yaml << EOF clonemap: - name: openstack-infra/devstack-gate dest: devstack-gate EOF /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner -m clonemap.yaml --cache-dir /opt/git \ git://git.openstack.org \ openstack-infra/devstack-gate executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x cat << 'EOF' >>"/tmp/dg-local.conf" [[local|localrc]] # enable freezer-agent and freezer-scheduler enable_plugin freezer git://git.openstack.org/openstack/freezer # enable freezer-api and python-freezerclient enable_plugin freezer-api https://git.openstack.org/openstack/freezer-api # enable freezer-web-ui and python-freezerclient enable_plugin freezer-web-ui https://git.openstack.org/openstack/freezer-web-ui EOF executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x export PYTHONUNBUFFERED=true # checkout freezer components export PROJECTS="openstack/freezer-api $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/freezer-web-ui $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/freezer $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/python-freezerclient $PROJECTS" export DEVSTACK_GATE_HORIZON=1 # tempest config export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_ALL_PLUGINS=1 TEMPEST_REGEX="$ZUUL_SHORT_PROJECT_NAME_tempest_plugin" export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX=${TEMPEST_REGEX/\-/\_ } # which repo is being tested export DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT=$ZUUL_SHORT_PROJECT_NAME # This ensures that if we set override branch to something # else, we still take repo being tested from the zuul branch # name. So override branch can be 'stable/mitaka' but we can # test master changes. uc_project=`echo $DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT | tr [:lower:] [:upper:] | tr '-' '_' | sed 's/[^A-Z_]//'` export "OVERRIDE_"$uc_project"_PROJECT_BRANCH"=$ZUUL_BRANCH function gate_hook { source $BASE/new/$ZUUL_SHORT_PROJECT_NAME/devstack/gate_hook.sh } export -f gate_hook cp devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}'

commit_message:
Make designate.conf reproducible

The hostname of the build machine leaks in the designate.conf.
Therefore, this patch sets sample_default='<Hostname>' to make
the build reproducible.

If you don't know about reproducible build, please read here:
https://wiki.debian.org/ReproducibleBuilds/About

Change-Id: I972aed4cf47510eb669d1db61c8f569136f861b6
Closes-Bug: #1736801
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/92/526192/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sample_default='<Hostname>',

commit_message:
fix variable definition in gating script

if there is no input then NODES_READY is undefined.
And next comparision operator is invalid.

Change-Id: I733f59d5e21695dde31891fc2b458427856bcce8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/33/517433/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NODES_READY="False" echo $SUB_NODE | grep -q ^Ready && NODES_READY="True"

commit_message:
extract checking VM to common functions

two checks - cli and heat uses same code to check VM.
extract it to common function. it will allow to change it simpler.

Change-Id: I4b1f62be507e96189b34870acc2cd904de3f4ab4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/34/517434/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check the VM check_vm ${FLOATING_IP} "${KEYPAIR_LOC}"
deleted_lines: # Ping our VM wait_for_ping ${FLOATING_IP} ${SERVICE_TEST_TIMEOUT} # Wait for SSH to come up wait_for_ssh_port ${FLOATING_IP} ${SERVICE_TEST_TIMEOUT} # SSH into the VM and check it can reach the outside world ssh-keyscan "$FLOATING_IP" >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts ssh -i ${KEYPAIR_LOC} cirros@${FLOATING_IP} ping -q -c 1 -W 2 ${OSH_BR_EX_ADDR%/*} # SSH into the VM and check it can reach the metadata server ssh -i ${KEYPAIR_LOC} cirros@${FLOATING_IP} curl -sSL 169.254.169.254 # Bonus round - display a Unicorn ssh -i ${KEYPAIR_LOC} cirros@${FLOATING_IP} curl http://artscene.textfiles.com/asciiart/unicorn || true

commit_message:
add info what happens and timeouts to dump_logs.sh

sometimes node is very slow to react to CLI and simple
call to get pods/logs can be more than 5 mins even it requires
1-2 seconds in normal system.
This patchset adds timeouts for such calls and printing info
what exatly logging now.

Change-Id: I3617adf9e946983908c92e2c4857e587f3a03033
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/35/517435/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "Getting status for object type: ${OBJECT_TYPE}" timeout -s 9 10 kubectl get ${OBJECT_TYPE} -o yaml > ${LOGS_DIR}/k8s/${OBJECT_TYPE}.yamlecho "Describing nodes" timeout -s 9 10 kubectl describe nodes > ${LOGS_DIR}/k8s/nodes.txt echo "Getting status for object type: ${OBJECT_TYPE}" timeout -s 9 10 kubectl get --all-namespaces ${OBJECT_TYPE} -o yaml > \timeout -s 9 10 kubectl get pods -a --all-namespaces -o json | jq -r \ echo "Getting logs for pod ${NAME}" timeout -s 9 10 kubectl get --namespace $NAMESPACE pod $NAME -o json | jq -r \ timeout -s 9 10 kubectl logs $NAME --namespace $NAMESPACE -c $CONTAINER > \timeout -s 9 10 kubectl get svc -o json --all-namespaces | jq -r \ echo "Describing svc for ${NAME}" timeout -s 9 10 kubectl describe svc $NAME --namespace $NAMESPACE > \timeout -s 9 10 kubectl get pvc -o json --all-namespaces | jq -r \ echo "Describing pvc for ${NAME}" timeout -s 9 10 kubectl describe pvc $NAME --namespace $NAMESPACE > \ echo "Getting status for object type: ${OBJECT_TYPE}" timeout -s 9 10 kubectl get ${OBJECT_TYPE} -o yaml > ${LOGS_DIR}/k8s/rbac/${OBJECT_TYPE}.yamlfor NAMESPACE in $(timeout -s 9 10 kubectl get namespaces -o name | awk -F '/' '{ print $NF }') ; do for OBJECT in $(timeout -s 9 10 kubectl get all --show-all -n $NAMESPACE -o name) ; do echo "Describing object: ${OBJECT}" timeout -s 9 10 kubectl describe -n $NAMESPACE $OBJECT > ${LOGS_DIR}/k8s/descriptions/${NAMESPACE}/$OBJECT_TYPE/$OBJECT_NAME.txtecho "Getting kubelet log from docker" sudo timeout -s 9 30 docker logs kubelet 2> ${LOGS_DIR}/nodes/${NODE_NAME}/kubelet.txt echo "Getting kubeadm-aio log from docker" sudo timeout -s 9 30 docker logs kubeadm-aio 2>&1 > ${LOGS_DIR}/nodes/${NODE_NAME}/kubeadm-aio.txt echo "Getting images from docker" sudo timeout -s 9 30 docker images --digests --no-trunc --all > ${LOGS_DIR}/nodes/${NODE_NAME}/images.txt echo "Getting various system information" sudo timeout -s 9 120 du -h --max-depth=1 /var/lib/docker | sort -hr > ${LOGS_DIR}/nodes/${NODE_NAME}/docker-size.txtsudo free -h > ${LOGS_DIR}/nodes/${NODE_NAME}/free.txt sudo df -h > ${LOGS_DIR}/nodes/${NODE_NAME}/df.txt echo "Getting kubelet log from docker for multinode ${NODE_IP}" echo "Getting kubeadm-aio log from docker for multinode ${NODE_IP}" echo "Getting images from docker for multinode ${NODE_IP}" echo "Getting various system information for multinode ${NODE_IP}" ssh -i ${SSH_PRIVATE_KEY} $(whoami)@${NODE_IP} sudo timeout -s 9 120 du -h --max-depth=1 /var/lib/docker | sort -hr > ${LOGS_DIR}/nodes/${NODE_NAME}/docker-size.txt ssh -i ${SSH_PRIVATE_KEY} $(whoami)@${NODE_IP} sudo free -h > ${LOGS_DIR}/nodes/${NODE_NAME}/free.txt ssh -i ${SSH_PRIVATE_KEY} $(whoami)@${NODE_IP} sudo df -h > ${LOGS_DIR}/nodes/${NODE_NAME}/df.txtecho "Getting openstack objects" echo "Getting rally logs" timeout -s 9 30 kubectl -n openstack logs $(kubectl -n openstack get pods -l job-name=rally-run-task --no-headers --output=name --show-all | awk -F '/' '{ print $NF; exit 0 }') > ${LOGS_DIR}/openstack/rally/rally_results.log
deleted_lines: kubectl get ${OBJECT_TYPE} -o yaml > ${LOGS_DIR}/k8s/${OBJECT_TYPE}.yamlkubectl describe nodes > ${LOGS_DIR}/k8s/nodes.txt kubectl get --all-namespaces ${OBJECT_TYPE} -o yaml > \kubectl get pods -a --all-namespaces -o json | jq -r \ kubectl get --namespace $NAMESPACE pod $NAME -o json | jq -r \ kubectl logs $NAME --namespace $NAMESPACE -c $CONTAINER > \kubectl get svc -o json --all-namespaces | jq -r \ kubectl describe svc $NAME --namespace $NAMESPACE > \kubectl get pvc -o json --all-namespaces | jq -r \ kubectl describe pvc $NAME --namespace $NAMESPACE > \ kubectl get ${OBJECT_TYPE} -o yaml > ${LOGS_DIR}/k8s/rbac/${OBJECT_TYPE}.yamlfor NAMESPACE in $(kubectl get namespaces -o name | awk -F '/' '{ print $NF }') ; do for OBJECT in $(kubectl get all --show-all -n $NAMESPACE -o name) ; do kubectl describe -n $NAMESPACE $OBJECT > ${LOGS_DIR}/k8s/descriptions/${NAMESPACE}/$OBJECT_TYPE/$OBJECT_NAME.txtsudo docker logs kubelet 2> ${LOGS_DIR}/nodes/${NODE_NAME}/kubelet.txt sudo docker logs kubeadm-aio 2>&1 > ${LOGS_DIR}/nodes/${NODE_NAME}/kubeadm-aio.txt sudo docker images --digests --no-trunc --all > ${LOGS_DIR}/nodes/${NODE_NAME}/images.txt sudo du -h --max-depth=1 /var/lib/docker | sort -hr > ${LOGS_DIR}/nodes/${NODE_NAME}/docker-size.txt ssh -i ${SSH_PRIVATE_KEY} $(whoami)@${NODE_IP} sudo du -h --max-depth=1 /var/lib/docker | sort -hr > ${LOGS_DIR}/nodes/${NODE_NAME}/docker-size.txt kubectl -n openstack logs $(kubectl -n openstack get pods -l job-name=rally-run-task --no-headers --output=name --show-all | awk -F '/' '{ print $NF; exit 0 }') > ${LOGS_DIR}/openstack/rally/rally_results.log

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/30/523830/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: It makes zuul run the gate jobs for the patch and merge it E.g. "Test failures are unrelated to this patch. bug xxxxxx." on the gerrit, you can re-trigger test jobs for the patch. Test jobs ``build-openstack-sphinx-docs`` and.. [#dashboards] https://docs.openstack.org/networking-midonet/latest/contributor/dashboards.html#gerrit-dashboards
deleted_lines: It makes the jenkins run the gate jobs for the patch and merge it E.g. "Jenkins failures are unrelated to this patch. bug xxxxxx." on the gerrit, you can re-trigger jenkins jobs for the patch. Jenkins jobs ``gate-networking-midonet-docs-ubuntu-xenial`` and.. [#dashboards] https://docs.openstack.org/networking-midonet/latest/dashboards/index.html#gerrit-dashboards

commit_message:
CI: Test multi-rbd backend for cinder in scenario001

Set THT parameters that will create an extra Ceph pool to be used
as an additional backend for Cinder.

Implements: blueprint multiple-cinder-rbd-backend
Change-Id: I84c5cfe8d77b541f18909f4c2b246df69b73cf22
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/49/519749/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CephPools: altrbd: pg_num: 8 pgp_num: 8 CinderRbdExtraPools: altrbd

commit_message:
add keystone and neutron tempest plugins to default config

keystone and neutron are the only two tempest plugins
that are required to be installed by default.

Change-Id: I58a955943191045324956bd61da0652076984e8c

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of the
_LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to avoid
confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I471d79a86d88e98688246ffbdc29fb579f5fd52a

subject: Base implementation of override_role for automatic role re-switch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-21 02:42:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/e29fe051ff480bf286c28b6e505811385d665a77', 'message': 'Base implementation of override_role for automatic role re-switch

This PS deprecated switch_role in rbac_utils and replaces it with
override_role. override_role realizes the same functionality as
switch_role, but uses @contextmanager so that role-switching can be
streamlined. This approach offers the following advantages:

  1) Role switching is performed in 1 class only. There is no
  need to call ``test_obj.switch_role(test_obj, toggle_rbac_role=False)``
  from ``rbac_rule_validation``. This de-coupling between both modules
  leads to cleaner, more readable code.
  2) Improves test code readability
  3) Improve policy granularity.

Rather than doing:

    # setup code here
    rand_name = data_utils.rand_name(...)
    # ...
    # more setup code here
    self.rbac_utils.switch_role(self, toggle_rbac_role=True)
    # execute the test here

(Without newlines, this code is very hard to read.)

It is instead possible to now do:

    # setup code here
    rand_name = data_utils.rand_name(...)
    # ...
    # more setup code here
    with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self, toggle_rbac_role=True)
        # execute the test here
        # notice the indentation... visually it is easy to see
        # that this block here is where the role is switched
    # now we are back to admin credentials in case we still
    # need it in the test... this was not possible before w/o
    # calling ``switch_role`` yet again...
    waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, ...)

This commit:
  1) Adds the necessary logic to rbac_utils to allow for automatic
     role re-switch following test execution (i.e. override_role)
  2) Deprecates switch_role method in rbac_utils
  3) Refactors RBAC tests in test_volumes_extend_rbac to prove
     the concept introduced here
  #5) Cleans up code in a few places in the tests

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

Change-Id: I670fba358bf321eae0d22d18cea6d2f530f00716
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-21 02:44:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/8c4548b8416a02bfbe67827d4bff9abb897cdad4', 'message': 'Base implementation of override_role for automatic role re-switch

    rand_name = data_utils.rand_name(...)
    # ...
    # more setup code here
    with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self):
        # execute the test here
        # notice the indentation... visually it is easy to see
        # that this block here is where the role is switched
    # now we are back to admin credentials in case we still
    # need it in the test... this was not possible before w/o
    # calling ``switch_role`` yet again...
    waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, ...)

This commit:
  * Adds the necessary logic to rbac_utils to allow for automatic
    role re-switch following test execution (i.e. override_role)
  * Deprecates switch_role method in rbac_utils
  * Refactors RBAC tests in test_volumes_extend_rbac to prove
    the concept introduced here
  * Removes _validate_switch_role functionality since its purpose
    was to overcompensate for the old switch_role interface which
    allowed users to pass in a boolean flag; now this is no longer
    needed. Also removes associated unit tests.

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

Change-Id: I670fba358bf321eae0d22d18cea6d2f530f00716

commit_message:
Base implementation of override_role for automatic role re-switch

This PS deprecated switch_role in rbac_utils and replaces it with
override_role. override_role realizes the same functionality as
switch_role, but uses @contextmanager so that role-switching can be
streamlined. This approach offers the following advantages:

  1) Role switching is performed in 1 class only. There is no
  need to call ``test_obj.switch_role(test_obj, toggle_rbac_role=False)``
  from ``rbac_rule_validation``. This de-coupling between both modules
  leads to cleaner, more readable code.
  2) Improves test code readability.
  3) Improve role switch granularity, meaning the role remains switched
     within the narrowest scope possible.
  4) Simplifies interface, making it easier for test-writers to use
     the Patrole framework.

Rather than doing:

    # setup code here
    rand_name = data_utils.rand_name(...)
    # ...
    # more setup code here
    self.rbac_utils.switch_role(self, toggle_rbac_role=True)
    # execute the test here

(Without newlines, this code is very hard to read.)

It is instead possible to now do:

    # setup code here
    rand_name = data_utils.rand_name(...)
    # ...
    # more setup code here
    with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self):
        # execute the test here
        # notice the indentation... visually it is easy to see
        # that this block here is where the role is switched
    # now we are back to admin credentials in case we still
    # need it in the test... this was not possible before w/o
    # calling ``switch_role`` yet again...
    waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, ...)

This commit:
  * Adds the necessary logic to rbac_utils to allow for automatic
    role re-switch following test execution (i.e. override_role)
  * Deprecates switch_role method in rbac_utils.
  * Refactors RBAC tests in test_volumes_extend_rbac to prove
    the concept introduced here.
  * Removes _validate_switch_role functionality since its purpose
    was to overcompensate for the old switch_role interface which
    allowed users to pass in a boolean flag; now this is no longer
    needed. Also removes associated unit tests.
  * Updates a docstring in rbac_utils module.

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

Change-Id: I670fba358bf321eae0d22d18cea6d2f530f00716
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/03/521703/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Implemented a new method ``override_role`` in ``rbac_utils`` module, which provides the exact same functionality as the now-deprecated ``switch_role`` method, with one difference: ``override_role`` is a contextmanager which provides better policy validationg granularity. This means that immediately after the contextmanager's code has executed, the role is switched back to the admin role automatically. deprecations: - | The ``switch_role`` method in ``rbac_utils`` module has been deprecated and will be removed during the Rocky release cycle.

We are seeing repeated gate failures due to a timeout on the
openstack-tox-cover job for Neutron. The default timeout inherited from

commit_message:
Increase timeout for running coverage job on Neutron

We are seeing repeated gate failures due to a timeout on the
openstack-tox-cover job for Neutron. The default timeout inherited from
the base job is 30 min, we are seeing successful runs taking about 25
minutes, which seems to be too tight a window. Increase the timeout to
60 minutes in order to be on the safe side.

Change-Id: I1e2036e2a0ae7a027c7227bfaa0009476e66e543
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/42/526342/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Enable Octavia LBaaS integration config in neutron

This patch includes the Octavia LBaaS puppet manifest in neutron when
Octavia is being deployed. This enables configuration of parameters
needed for Neutron to communicate with Octavia.

Change-Id: Ia3d4f9f6e93fa9affd8b732b90fccc027ee62fd1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/54/525854/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*octavia_nodes*] # (Optional) List of nodes running the Octavia API service. If not # empty, indicates that Octavia is part of this deployment and # the Octavia integration parameters should be configured. # Defaults to hiera('octavia_api_node_ips', undef) # $octavia_nodes = hiera('octavia_api_node_ips', undef), if $octavia_nodes { include ::neutron::services::lbaas::octavia }

commit_message:
Add composable networks documentation

Adds a first-pass of documentation for the new composable networks
feature which was added during the Pike release.

Partially-Implements: blueprint composable-networks
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1cb64796699fce8522326c6651a7fd001cb73a66
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/93/521493/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _custom_networks: Deploying with Custom Networks ============================== TripleO offers the option of deploying with a user-defined list of networks, where each network can be enabled (or not) for each role (group of servers) in the deployment. Default networks ---------------- TripleO offers a default network topology when deploying with network isolation enabled, and this is reflected in the network_data.yaml file in `openstack-tripleo-heat-templates`. These default networks are as follows: * External - External network traffic (disabled by default for Compute/Storage nodes) * InternalApi - Internal API traffic, most intra-service traffic uses this network by default * Storage - Storage traffic * StorageMgmt - Storage management traffic (such as replication traffic between storage nodes) * Tenant - Tenant networks for compute workloads running on the cloud * Management - Dedicated management network for use by administrators (disabled by default) Deploying with custom networks ------------------------------ Each network is defined in the `network_data.yaml` file. There is a sample file in `/usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates`, or the tripleo-heat-templates_ git repository which can be copied and modified as needed. The `network_data.yaml` file contains a list of networks, with a definition like: - name: CustomNetwork vip: false name_lower: custom_network ip_subnet: '172.16.6.0/24' allocation_pools: [{'start': '172.16.6.4', 'end': '172.16.6.250'}] gateway_ip: '172.16.6.1' The data in `network_data.yaml` is used to perform templating with jinja2_ such that arbitrary user-defined networks may be added, and the default networks may be modified or removed. The steps to define your custom networks are: 1. Copy the default `network_data.yaml` provided by `tripleo-heat-templates` cp /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/network_data.yaml custom_network_data.yaml 2. Modify the `custom_network_data.yaml` file as required The network data is a list of networks, where each network containers at least the following items - name: Name of the network (mandatory) - vip: Enable creation of a virtual IP on this network - ip_subnet: IP/CIDR, e.g. '10.0.0.0/24' - allocation_pools: IP range list e.g. [{'start':'10.0.0.4', 'end':'10.0.0.250'}] - gateway_ip: gateway for the network Other options are supported, see the documentation in the default `network_data.yaml` for details. .. warning:: Currently there is no validation of the network subnet and allocation_pools, so care must be take to ensure these are consistent, and do not conflict with any existing networks, otherwise your deployment may fail or result in unexpected results. 3. Copy network configuration templates, add new networks At present the nic config templates are not dynamically generated, so it is necessary to copy those that are in use, and add parameters for any additional networks, e.g: cp -r /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/network/config/single-nic-vlans custom-single-nic-vlans Each file in single-nic-vlans will require update to add parameters for each custom network (copy those that exist for the default networks, and rename to match the "name" field in custom_network_data.yaml 4. Adjust your network-environment to reference the modified nic templates It is necessary to adjust the environment paths to match the location of the copied nic templates above: cp /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates//environments/net-single-nic-with-vlans.yaml custom-net-single-nic-with-vlans.yaml <edit the paths for each role to reference custom-single-nic-vlans directory created above> 5. Deploy with custom networks To deploy you pass the custom_network_data.yaml file via the "-n" option to the overcloud deploy, e.g: openstack overcloud deploy --templates -n custom_network_data.yaml -e custom-net-single-nic-with-vlans.yaml .. note:: It is also possible to copy the entire tripleo-heat-templates tree, and modify the network_data.yaml file in place, then deploy via `--templates <copy of tht>` .. _tripleo-heat-templates: https://git.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates .. _jinja2: http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/dev/

commit_message:
Support populating certificate files

This patch extends octavia::certificates to support populating
certificate and key files using data passed in string form.

Change-Id: I8d46bad372b8c24b290500ee6040207cb808ba23
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-octavia refs/changes/26/526226/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Adds parameters to 'octavia::certificates' to support populating certificate and key files with data provided.

subject: Adding query metric mappings, dimensions, futurist, paging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-07 00:40:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-ceilometer/commit/87aa2969a4c7080803748fde2c0bfdea6e3ead6a', 'message': 'Adding query metric mappings, dimensions, futurist, paging

Adding capabilities to ceilosca to be able to query metrics that
are already being collected by monasca using mappings files
there are two types of mappings:
  1. Static Mapping: Currently it is used to map any static info
     about ceilometer meters like the type of meter or unit
  2. Extensive monasca mapping: currently it is used to map any
     monasca metric to a ceilometer meter example:
     meter_metric_map:

ceilometer configuration file

cloud_name, cluster_name, and control plane fields
are now added as dimensions by monasca publisher when
publishing metrics to monasca api which is necessary

monasca publisher does not use oslo.service LoopingCall
but instead uses futurist periodics library to enable
batching.

monasca client now pages through monasca api results
if enable_api_pagination is enabled in configuration.
This flag is disabled by default but should be enabled
if monasca api supports paging using "offsets"
parameter.

Tox testing is now targeting stable/newton branch of
ceilometer.

DocImpact

Ceilometer newton-eol

Change the test-requirements to use the newton-eol branch, as
the stable/newton branch no longer exists in Ceilometer.
Also limit the oslotest to < 2.0.0 to avoid a mockpatch issue
in ceilometer's db.py unit test.

Note this change should soon be replaced by a move to Pike, but
want to update this as a solid starting point before further work.

This matches change I 06b860bb72c3397e2763 11bd57291e9c3164a7e4

commit_message:
Adding query metric mappings, dimensions, futurist, paging

Adding capabilities to ceilosca to be able to query metrics that
are already being collected by monasca using mappings files
there are two types of mappings:
  1. Static Mapping: Currently it is used to map any static info
     about ceilometer meters like the type of meter or unit
  2. Extensive monasca mapping: currently it is used to map any
     monasca metric to a ceilometer meter example:
     meter_metric_map:
       - name: "disk.device.write.requests"
            monasca_metric_name: "vm.io.write_ops"
            resource_id: $.dimensions.resource_id
            project_id: $.dimensions.tenant_id
            user_id: $.dimensions.user_id
            region: "NA"
            type: "cumulative"
            unit: "request"
            source: "NA"
            resource_metadata: $.measurement[0][2]
     As you can see for this mapping fields on left side of ":"
     are used to map ceilometer fields and fields on right side
     for referring to monasca fields

Both of these mapping files are configurable and can be set in
ceilometer configuration file

cloud_name, cluster_name, and control plane fields
are now added as dimensions by monasca publisher when
publishing metrics to monasca api which is necessary
in multi-region deployment of notification agent.

monasca publisher does not use oslo.service LoopingCall
but instead uses futurist periodics library to enable
batching.

monasca client now pages through monasca api results
if enable_api_pagination is enabled in configuration.
This flag is disabled by default but should be enabled
if monasca api supports paging using "offsets"
parameter.

Tox testing is now targeting stable/newton branch of
ceilometer.

DocImpact

Ceilometer newton-eol

Change the test-requirements to use the newton-eol branch, as
the stable/newton branch no longer exists in Ceilometer.
Also limit the oslotest to < 2.0.0 to avoid a mockpatch issue
in ceilometer's db.py unit test.

Note this change should soon be replaced by a move to Pike, but
want to update this as a solid starting point before further work.

This matches change I 06b860bb72c3397e2763 11bd57291e9c3164a7e4

Change-Id: I83b96325cb79d82858cf529935e5d699a509f6c3

commit_message:
Allow specifying targets in ini file

this patch makes 'targets' args optional and allows to specify them
in the ini file.
This makes it possible to keep most of bandit configuration right in
the ini file.
OpenStack projects can now populate their tox.ini with [bandit] section
and do 'bandit --ini {toxinidir}/tox.ini -r' almost uniformly
accross all projects.

Change-Id: Ia0153e0aaa602171690ca8f66635fbea69b1cfab
Closes-Bug: #1730307

commit_message:
Accept only domain as well as OneView manager url

The prepare_manager_url only works when manager_url contains http or
https. One should be able to define the OneView manager_url using
either http, https or just the domain. This patch updates the
prepare_manager_url to accept those three cases.

Closes-Bug: 1730652
Change-Id: Ie09fc9e7fab1b58432f17402ebe3aa5aa4dc4261
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/97/517997/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import re url_match = "^(http[s]?://)?([^/]+)(/.*)?$" manager_url = re.search(url_match, manager_url).group(2)

commit_message:
Remove build-openstack-sphinx-docs from i18n

The i18n project can't use the new PTI because it does extra things in
its docs tox environment to get the job done. Remove
build-openstack-sphinx-docs from openstack/i18n in favor of the in-tree
job that was added.

Change-Id: I1c620f244df90c4ac0736b5e1422f0776589f417
Depends-On: I5237e750b4bc4899d71952a14c8d2ca92d9985a0

commit_message:
[APIv2]Nix custom OpenStack-Project-ID header

We don't need to be special/annoying. Other services whose APIs don't
need project ID in the URL do just fine trusting keystonemiddleware to
provide that info.

bp v2-api-experimental-impl

Change-Id: I8397ed7c134f0742de8c38466ed3f9035d8103d4

commit_message:
Add heat-tempest-plugin to grenade/sahara job

Otherwise the heat grenade plugin, which is enabled and used by Sahara,
fails, because the heat tests have been split but they are used by the
grenade plugin.

It is true that this could be migrated locally to sahara repositories,
but the effort is to try to push native jobs directly.

Change-Id: I15d1c25f5701e8fd3450f61cc661515639ba434a

commit_message:
Fix auth version detection

If OS_CLOUD is not set the defalt value is parsed which is empty string. This
is wrong, as it deactivates all other environment variables for cloud
configuration.

Change-Id: I48452bb5300fcc46047f8e94501bba1c42629ea1
Story: 2001158
Task: 4890
(cherry picked from commit fecf0e3d664e2681a0f5ba0a94b2359935d3a353)

commit_message:
Publish deploy guide updates for all branches

The deploy guide for projects may change after the creation
of the stable branch, and those changes are not currently
publishing - instead leaving the deploy guide in the state
it was last published before the stable branch existed.

This changes the job to ensure that updates for all branches
are published, not just the master branch.

Change-Id: Id515a869ca43352a72953e7a2f50db364773b4ae

commit_message:
Don't attempt to run py27 on nova-specs

With the move to zuulv3, the py27 job is never run on
nova-specs changes because the openstack-tox-py27 job
definition in openstack-zuul-jobs ignores changes to
docs and rst files, which is basically all that is in
the nova-specs repo. So we've dropped the py27 target
in nova-specs and just run the same tests under pep8.

Change-Id: I8300f3c9270095f9fd0ab0dbc8cd8155252d08ff
Depends-On: Ic87e79db6a8881398d670148b609e0b81658dfd1

commit_message:
Add an openstack/self-healing-sig repository

The Self-healing SIG is interested in using Storyboard for task
tracking purposes. At the moment our means of avoiding name
collisions is to make sure each project in SB has a matching
repository in Gerrit, so create the necessary repo as a placeholder
(it may be used for revision control of documents or other artifacts
pertaining to the SIG in the future, but they have no actual plans
for it at this time).

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Self-healing_SIG
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-sigs/2017-December/000198.html

Change-Id: If4fed236b6a679a635e17984f1cd07e98e21758c
Needed-By: Ie2bba5e8914eb5422974b968183498471fae37cb

subject: Make stable jobs voting on Tempest
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-01 22:09:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/1ed34fd4704c37d5bbebb93c0859867996eb31b1', 'message': 'Make stable jobs voting on Tempest

Stable jobs have always been voting on Tempest to prevent Tempest

commit_message:
Make stable jobs voting on Tempest

Stable jobs have always been voting on Tempest to prevent Tempest
changes from breaking stable branches. We never ran stable jobs on gate
though and I think that should stay the same. Given the low volume of
changes on stable, it's highgly unlikely that a change that passes in
check behaves differently on gate.

The voting part was lost in the zuulv3 migration, so restoring it.

Change-Id: Ifa69d4ea405f6c243eddf303cff7dcedec4bad4d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-01 11:10:20.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/projects.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/cbc566175e0ce5e5aba0c3d11f26bfc70ecf8d55', 'message': "Move governance tag validation to experimental

The governance repository 'validate' test job currently only
tests that the diversity tags match the current demographics
in the project teams.

It is useful to validate diversity tag changes, but not so
much as a test job run on every change. Since diversity tags
are not continuously updated, it is expected that after a few
weeks the job will systematically fail.

It is still useful information in some cases, for example when
a new team is proposed and you're not sure which diversity tag
they should get, or when diversity tags are updated.

Move the validate test job to the experimental pipeline so that

Change-Id: I420bd7bd568d102248dde43137a0a9273dfc6c41
"}]
commit_message:
Move governance tag validation to experimental

The governance repository 'validate' test job currently only
tests that the diversity tags match the current demographics
in the project teams.

It is useful to validate diversity tag changes, but not so
much as a test job run on every change. Since diversity tags
are not continuously updated, it is expected that after a few
weeks the job will systematically fail.

It is still useful information in some cases, for example when
a new team is proposed and you're not sure which diversity tag
they should get, or when diversity tags are updated.

Move the validate test job to the experimental pipeline so that
the information can be retrieved in those specific cases by
running 'check experimental' as needed.

Change-Id: I420bd7bd568d102248dde43137a0a9273dfc6c41

commit_message:
Creating a function that calls /usr/bin/timeout

Due the fact that in the future, we will have several ansible-playbooks
calls, we need to create a function that will calculate the remaining time
for each call. This function gets the START_JOB_TIME and
calculate how much time still has, and execute the command with
/usr/bin/timeout

Change-Id: Ib4766ea144baaaf1b47899c4923adf40a3be4582
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/94/525594/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function run_with_timeout() { # First parameter is the START_JOB_TIME # Second is the command to be executed $JOB_TIME=$1 shift COMMAND=$@ # Use $REMAINING_TIME of infra to calculate maximum time for remaning part of job # Leave 15 minutes for quickstart logs collection REMAINING_TIME=${REMAINING_TIME:-180} TIME_FOR_DEPLOY=$(( REMAINING_TIME - ($(date +%s) - JOB_TIME)/60 - 10)) /usr/bin/timeout --preserve-status ${TIME_FOR_DEPLOY}m ${COMMAND} && exit_value=0 || exit_value=$? echo $exit_value }

commit_message:
Shutdown placement at the end of the base run

Placement API was not being shutdown at the end of the OLD target,
thus when it was being started at the beginning of the NEW target it
was not actually getting new code. A call to stop_placement is added.

In addition, make sure placement is installed in upgrade.sh so that
any new stuff is in place.

The depends-on is to a devstack change which makes sure that
lib/placement does not call remove_uwsgi_config when stop_placement is
called. Without this, there's no config file for the
devstack@placement-api systemd unit to run, and there is an immediate
exit.

Change-Id: I7f2158aeaef82a47e11c6e29675e542023fff4be
Depends-On: Iee763adf7895145d97b184924896db3f1f48a015
Closes-Bug: #1736385

commit_message:
Add IPv6 support to create_websocket()

The current implementation is hardcoded to use AF_INET, which means
IPv4. We need to be able to support IPv6 connections, too, so we use the
socket.getaddrinfo() function as described in [1] in order to provide a
more generic solution.

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/socket.html

Change-Id: I2ccbe3b25e79031a3c961871034c0c1b94d7ee80
Closes-Bug: 1719575
Related-Bug: 1656329
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/23/507823/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for res in socket.getaddrinfo(url.hostname, url.port, socket.AF_UNSPEC, socket.SOCK_STREAM): af, socktype, proto, canonname, sa = res client_socket = socket.socket(af, socktype, proto) if url.scheme == 'https': client_socket = ssl.wrap_socket(client_socket) client_socket.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_REUSEADDR, 1) try: client_socket.connect(sa) except socket.error: client_socket.close() continue break
deleted_lines: if url.scheme == 'https': client_socket = ssl.wrap_socket(socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM)) else: client_socket = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM) client_socket.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_REUSEADDR, 1) client_socket.connect((url.hostname, url.port))
