commit_message:
Migrate to using ansible for endpoint creation

This patch replaces the `openstack` commands with an ansible playbook.

Change-Id: I0bc5b86074e9a4cc204fd807e1a361d5f9f184e2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-k8s-tripleo refs/changes/50/518450/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Create keystone endpoints - ansible - localhost - -m - os_user - -a - "cloud={{namespace}} state=present name={{service_username}} password={{service_password}} default_project={{service_project}}"
deleted_lines: - name: Create glance keystone job - openstack - --os-cloud - "{{namespace}}" - user - create - --project - '{{service_project}}' - --password - '{{service_password}}' - '{{service_username}}'

subject: XenAPI: support XenAPI in nova configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-28 14:57:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/a043347a3b864189412d5da5c009dcdc22d9b562', 'message': "XenAPI: support XenServer deployment.

This contains the following chanages to support XenServer:

1. XenAPI is the virt type for XenServer, add XenAPI as the new option
for nova_compute_virt_type

2. Customize the service configuration for XenAPI

3. Create a new role for XenAPI:
In XenServer, there is a privileged domain which is known as dom0; and
it can run a number of un-privileged domains which is known as domU.
The OpenStack services run in domU. Some compute relative services
(e.g nova-compute, neutron-openvswitch-agent, ceilometer-compute) run
in a domU but need communicate with dom0 to performance some hyperviosr
operations: e.g. boot VMs; controler dom0' openvswitch; query metrics data.
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html

These services use XenAPI to communicate with dom0 through the
host internal management network (HIMN). When preparing the VMs where
the OpenStack compute services will run on, we can use the XenCenter's
HIMN plugin to create this network and attach the VM to this network
from XenCenter - https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin.

So besides the common tasks, we need some additional tasks for XenAPI:
- detect the interface connected to HIMN in domU;
- install XAPI plugins to dom0;
- install packages to dom0;
- configure iptables to allow the traffic between dom0 and OpenStack endpoits.
- etc.

The above operations will be implemented via tools belong a separate package.
But we need a new role to hold these tasks which invoke those tools. This
commit created a new role named as nova-xenapi which will be applied at early
phase so that the needed preperation work completed before other common
deployment start.

4. Add a new neutron-openvswitch-agent service:
For XenServer, we need two instances of L2Agent (neutron-openvswitch-agent
service): one manage the OpenvSwitches in domU and the other manage the
OpenvSwitches located in dom0.
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/matelakat/shared/xs-q-v1/xenserver-quantum/deployment.png

So we propose to add a new neutron-openvswitch-agent service which manages
a remote host (it's dom0 for XenServer); the new service will use the same
docker image as the existing one but the ml2 configure file need to be
customized so that it can manage the remote host properly.

Change-Id: Id34d247ab78976627f8e70685f27470b254cd418
blueprint: xenserver-support
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-09-30 10:51:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/014d45456a50a53896c170d092551dde8505c8db', 'message': "XenAPI: upport XenServer deployment.

manages the ovs in dom0 for XenServer, the new service will use the same
docker image as the existing one but the ml2 configure file need to be
customized so that it can manage the remote host properly.

Change-Id: Id34d247ab78976627f8e70685f27470b254cd418
blueprint: xenserver-support
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2017-10-11 06:06:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/003af321aa4831944a4bee6af5d363f6117ed645', 'message': "XenAPI: upport XenServer deployment.

This contains the following chanages to support XenServer:

1. XenAPI is the virt type for XenServer, add XenAPI as the new option
for nova_compute_virt_type

2. Customize the service configuration for XenAPI

3. Create a new role for XenAPI:
In XenServer, there is a privileged domain which is known as dom0; and
it can run a number of un-privileged domains which is known as domU.
The OpenStack services run in domU. Some compute relative services
(e.g nova-compute, neutron-openvswitch-agent, ceilometer-compute) run
in a domU but need communicate with dom0 to performance some hyperviosr
operations: e.g. boot VMs; controler dom0' openvswitch; query metrics data.
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html

These services use XenAPI to communicate with dom0 through the
host internal management network (HIMN). When preparing the VMs where
the OpenStack compute services will run on, we can use the XenCenter's
HIMN plugin to create this network and attach the VM to this network
from XenCenter - https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin.

So besides the common tasks, we need some additional tasks for XenAPI:
- detect the interface connected to HIMN in domU;
- install XAPI plugins to dom0;
- install packages to dom0;
- configure iptables to allow the traffic between dom0 and OpenStack endpoits.
- etc.

The above operations will be implemented via tools belong a separate package.
But we need a new role to hold these tasks which invoke those tools. This
commit created a new role named as nova-xenapi which will be applied at early
phase so that the needed preperation work completed before other common
deployment start.

4. Add a new neutron-openvswitch-agent service:
For XenServer, besides the default neutron-openvswitch-agent service which
manage locally manage the Open vSwitches located in the target host where
the service runs on, it also requires another instance of the service of
neutron-openvswitch-agent which remotely manage the Open vSwitches located
in dom0.
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/matelakat/shared/xs-q-v1/xenserver-quantum/deployment.png

So we propose to add a new neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi service which
manages the ovs in dom0 for XenServer, the new service will use the same
docker image as the existing one but the ml2 configure file need to be
customized so that it can manage the remote host properly.

Change-Id: Id34d247ab78976627f8e70685f27470b254cd418
blueprint: xenserver-support

When using XenAPI as the virt driver, we need some XenAPI
specific configure options. This commit is to ensure nova's
configuration can be generated correctly for XenAPI. It
includes the folowing changes:
* Add XenAPI as one of the valid options for nova_compute_virt_type;
* Configure some options when XenAPI is chosen as the virt type.

This commit does NOT include the host and [vnc] configurations which
will be covered by a following commit.

References:
* XenServer (and other XAPI based Xen variants):
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html
* XenCenter HIMN plugin (adding HIMN network which is used by XenAPI driver to
  communicate with XenServer):
  https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin
* nova configuration options:
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/configuration/config.html

Change-Id: Id34d247ab78976627f8e70685f27470b254cd418

commit_message:
XenAPI: support XenAPI in nova configuration

When using XenAPI as the virt driver, we need some XenAPI
specific configure options. This commit is to ensure nova's
configuration can be generated correctly for XenAPI. It
includes the folowing changes:
* Add XenAPI as one of the valid options for nova_compute_virt_type;
* Configure some options when XenAPI is chosen as the virt type.

This commit does NOT include the host and [vnc] configurations which
will be covered by a following commit.

References:
* XenServer (and other XAPI based Xen variants):
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html
* XenCenter HIMN plugin (adding HIMN network which is used by XenAPI driver to
  communicate with XenServer):
  https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin
* nova configuration options:
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/configuration/config.html

Change-Id: Id34d247ab78976627f8e70685f27470b254cd418
blueprint: xenserver-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/96/508196/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Valid options are [ qemu, kvm, vmware, xenapi ] ####################################### # XenAPI - Support XenAPI for XenServer ####################################### # the ip address for HIMN (Host Internal Management Network) xenserver_himn_ip: "169.254.0.1" xenserver_username: "root" xenserver_password: "root_passwd" xenserver_insecure: "True"
deleted_lines: # Valid options are [ qemu, kvm, vmware ]

commit_message:
Preserve X-Static-Large-Object from .data file after POST

You can't modify the X-Static-Large-Object metadata with a POST, an
object being a SLO is a property of the .data file.  Revert the change
from 4500ff which attempts to correctly handle X-Static-Large-Object
metadata on a POST, but is subject to a race if the most recent SLO
.data isn't available during the POST.  Instead this change adjusts the
reading of metadata such that the X-Static-Large-Object metadata is
always preserved from the metadata on the datafile and bleeds through
a .meta if any.

Closes-bug: #1453807
Closes-bug: #1634723

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: Ie48a38442559229a2993443ab0a04dc84717ca59
(cherry picked from commit 36a843be73e2d58c3fe49a049d514b421124bd06)

deleted_lines: DATAFILE_SYSTEM_META = set('content-length deleted etag'.split()) if key.lower() in DATAFILE_SYSTEM_META

commit_message:
Preserve X-Static-Large-Object from .data file after POST

You can't modify the X-Static-Large-Object metadata with a POST, an
object being a SLO is a property of the .data file.  Revert the change
from 4500ff which attempts to correctly handle X-Static-Large-Object
metadata on a POST, but is subject to a race if the most recent SLO
.data isn't available during the POST.  Instead this change adjusts the
reading of metadata such that the X-Static-Large-Object metadata is
always preserved from the metadata on the datafile and bleeds through
a .meta if any.

Closes-bug: #1453807
Closes-bug: #1634723

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: Ie48a38442559229a2993443ab0a04dc84717ca59
(cherry picked from commit 36a843be73e2d58c3fe49a049d514b421124bd06)

deleted_lines: DATAFILE_SYSTEM_META = set('content-length deleted etag'.split()) if key.lower() in DATAFILE_SYSTEM_META

subject: Use "poll" or "selects" Eventlet hub for all Swift daemons.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-17 00:56:06.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/replicator.py', 'swift/obj/reconstructor.py', 'swift/common/daemon.py', 'swift/common/utils.py', 'test/unit/common/test_daemon.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/bf5b49c333906171d9653290baf5a8d16f69b7c8', 'message': 'Use "poll" or "selects" Eventlet hub for all Swift daemons.

Previously, Swift's WSGI servers, the object replicator, and the
object reconstructor were setting Eventlet's hub to either "poll" or
"selects", depending on availability. Other daemons were letting
Eventlet use its default hub, which is "epoll".

In any daemons that fork, we really don't want to use epoll. Epoll
instances end up shared between the parent and all children, and you
get some awful messes when file descriptors are shared.

Here's an example where two processes are trying to wait on the same
file descriptor using the same epoll instance, and everything goes
wrong:

[proc A] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_ADD, 3, ...) = 0

[proc B] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_ADD, 3, ...) = -1 EEXIST (File exists)
[proc B] epoll_wait(6, ...) = 1
[proc B] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_DEL, 3, ...) = 0

[proc A] epoll_wait(6, ...)

This primarily affects the container updater and object updater since
they fork. I've decided to change the hub for all Swift daemons so
that we don't add multiprocessing support to some other daemon someday
and suffer through this same bug again.

This problem was made more apparent by commit 6d16079, which made our
logging mutex use file descriptors. However, it could have struck on
any shared file descriptor on which a read or write returned EAGAIN.

Change-Id: Iebc1491f2ed86ed0db9e7eb0e3277c88076225e1
'}]
commit_message:
Use "poll" or "selects" Eventlet hub for all Swift daemons.

Previously, Swift's WSGI servers, the object replicator, and the
object reconstructor were setting Eventlet's hub to either "poll" or
"selects", depending on availability. Other daemons were letting
Eventlet use its default hub, which is "epoll".

In any daemons that fork, we really don't want to use epoll. Epoll
instances end up shared between the parent and all children, and you
get some awful messes when file descriptors are shared.

Here's an example where two processes are trying to wait on the same
file descriptor using the same epoll instance, and everything goes
wrong:

[proc A] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_ADD, 3, ...) = 0

[proc B] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_ADD, 3, ...) = -1 EEXIST (File exists)
[proc B] epoll_wait(6, ...) = 1
[proc B] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_DEL, 3, ...) = 0

[proc A] epoll_wait(6, ...)

This primarily affects the container updater and object updater since
they fork. I've decided to change the hub for all Swift daemons so
that we don't add multiprocessing support to some other daemon someday
and suffer through this same bug again.

This problem was made more apparent by commit 6d16079, which made our
logging mutex use file descriptors. However, it could have struck on
any shared file descriptor on which a read or write returned EAGAIN.

Change-Id: Iebc1491f2ed86ed0db9e7eb0e3277c88076225e1

commit_message:
burst should be set near max-rate

Burst value for TCP traffic should be set as 80% of desired bandwidth
limit value. For example, if the bandwidth limit is set to 1000kbps
then enough burst value will be 800kbit. If the configured burst value
is too low, achieved bandwidth limit will be lower than expected.
If the configured burst value is too high, too few packets could
be limited and achieved bandwidth limit would be higher than expected.

So we should recommend a correct example in case that user ignores
the note.

Change-Id: Iefea3ce699c39e217e89dec93a8fe8ea1a90ac82

deleted_lines: --max-burst-kbits 300 --egress bw-limiter | max_burst_kbps | 300 | $ openstack network qos rule set --max-kbps 2000 --max-burst-kbits 200 \ | max_burst_kbps | 200 |

commit_message:
Add CREATE_PRECOMMIT notification for Floating IPs

This patch is adding a CREATE_PRECOMMIT notification for floating ips.
Before it was possible to register a callback for that (no errors) but
the notification would never be sent because the code was simple not in
place.

Closes-Bug: #1736201

commit_message:
placement: allow filter providers in tree

Adds a new 'in_tree' filter parameter to the
ResourceProviderList.get_all_by_filters() method. This parameter allows
the caller to get providers in the "provider tree" of a supplied
provider UUID.

Change-Id: If35ee6a90ca0a999f6c4815e6f5e99d9962dcc46
blueprint: nested-resource-providers
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/15/377215/72 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check all providers returned when getting by root UUID rps = objects.ResourceProviderList.get_all_by_root_provider_uuid( self.context, uuidsentinel.root_rp ) self.assertEqual(3, len(rps))

commit_message:
Setup tox

Setup tox with pep8, linters and reno jobs so that CI passes for the
tripleo-upgrades repo.

Change-Id: I2cd200eb77501717211c0db3f52c96c2c7b22663
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/76/525676/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [tox] minversion = 1.6 envlist = docs, linters skipdist = True [testenv] usedevelop = True install_command = pip install -c{env:UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt} {opts} {packages} setenv = VIRTUAL_ENV={envdir} deps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt whitelist_externals = bash [testenv:bindep] # Do not install any requirements. We want this to be fast and work even if # system dependencies are missing, since it's used to tell you what system # dependencies are missing! This also means that bindep must be installed # separately, outside of the requirements files. deps = bindep commands = bindep test [testenv:docs] commands = python setup.py build_sphinx [testenv:bashate] commands = # Run bashate check for all bash scripts # Ignores the following rules: # E006: Line longer than 79 columns (as many scripts use jinja # templating, this is very difficult) # E040: Syntax error determined using `bash -n` (as many scripts # use jinja templating, this will often fail and the syntax # error will be discovered in execution anyway) bash -c "git ls-files | xargs grep --binary-files=without-match \ --files-with-match '^.!.*\(ba\)\?sh$' \ --exclude-dir .tox \ --exclude-dir .git \ | xargs bashate --error . --verbose --ignore=E006,E040" [testenv:pep8] commands = # Run hacking/flake8 check for all python files bash -c "git ls-files | xargs grep --binary-files=without-match \ --files-with-match '^.!.*python$' \ --exclude-dir .tox \ --exclude-dir .git \ --exclude-dir .eggs \ --exclude-dir *.egg-info \ --exclude-dir dist \ --exclude-dir *lib/python* \ --exclude-dir doc \ | xargs flake8 --verbose" [testenv:ansible-lint] basepython=python2 commands = bash ci-scripts/ansible-lint.sh [testenv:linters] commands = {[testenv:bashate]commands} {[testenv:pep8]commands} {[testenv:ansible-lint]commands} [testenv:releasenotes] whitelist_externals = bash commands = bash -c ci-scripts/releasenotes_tox.sh [testenv:venv] commands = {posargs} [flake8] # E123, E125 skipped as they are invalid PEP-8. show-source = True ignore = E123,E125 builtins = _

commit_message:
Fix non-destructive upgrade for deprecated res types in convergence

When a user updates from a deprecated resource type to an
equivalent-but-differently-named one (e.g. from
OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployments to OS::Heat::SoftwareDeploymentGroup), Heat
is supposed to change the type without replacing the resource as it would
normally do when a resource type changes. This was broken in convergence,
because since 45073226752c58d640ea5a59b7e532c022a4939b the new Resource
object we create during the check_resource operation (using the new type's
plugin) is no longer automatically initialised with data from the database
as resources in the legacy path are.

Move the substitution checking to the Resource.load() method, so that it
now returns an instance of the new plugin where allowed. In the actual
update_convergence() method then we need only check that the resource class
is the one we'd expect from the new template, and replace the resource if
not.

We do have a test that is designed to check that this is working, but in it
we didn't compare the physical IDs of the resource that is potentially
getting replaced, but rather the physical IDs of some other resource that
can't possibly get modified (surprise! it doesn't change).

Change-Id: I75778abc303525a71d0a918f7192f00a43c21284
Closes-Bug: #1729439

commit_message:
Instance HA support

This commit is the puppet-tripleo part that implements the instance HA
spec. It only adds a couple of pacemaker resources and stonith devices
when instance HA is activated via an environment variable.

The compute nodes that take part in instance HA need to have the
following services added to them:
OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeInstanceHA
OS::TripleO::Services::PacemakerRemote

More detailed info will be added to the docs.

blueprint instance-ha

Change-Id: I4d1908242e9513a225d2b1da06ed4ee769ee10f7

commit_message:
Update capabilities-map.yaml to include latest storage environments

* updated Ceph features to use environments from ceph-ansible
* added docker-ha.yaml as HA option
* added containers-deafult-parameters.yaml

Closes-Bug: 1735214
Change-Id: I5845e8ca5212a0b97c21d6e44db0e0a1ddfc23fc
(cherry picked from commit 9726a78ea97ce56ca29cd9c144ca0fb79de696a1)

commit_message:
deploy-steps.j2: use ansible to bootstrap environment

We introduced a new Ansible role, tripleo-bootstrap:
I560273be2ebe3a49ff37e3682222706939e5d879

This role will take care of preparing an environment that will deploy
TripleO later.
This patch aims to use execute this new role on all hosts.
We don't gather_facts, (already gathered previously), we want to fail on
any error and also the role will be executed on pre_deploy_steps tag.

Change-Id: If9306473701a340d577bbe0a4a7dfee90be99c2f
Depends-On: I560273be2ebe3a49ff37e3682222706939e5d879
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/91/525291/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - hosts: all name: Bootstrap TripleO servers gather_facts: no any_errors_fatal: yes roles: - tripleo-bootstrap tags: - pre_deploy_steps

commit_message:
Fix loop in config-download.yaml.j2 template

We need 2 separate loops here, otherwise when deploying with multiple
subnodes, you get the DeployedServerPortMap parameter repeated which
means only the last would take effect.

Also fixes the hardcoding of the hostname and ip address using the
special jinja2 loop.index0 variable.[1]

[1] http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/2.10/templates/#for

Change-Id: I020c0b690b9848b53e468c67e91d6659eb6bb619

commit_message:
To make etcd models object more like a dict.

Add items iteritems and keys functions in etcd.models:Base to
make the etcd model object more like a dict. When we need pass
the dict object, we don't need use model.as_dict any more, pass
the model object will be ok. Just like the way we use sql model
object.

Change-Id: Ic4d7e1c1cc266ee6d265b56e0ab56643ec86105a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/09/526009/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def items(self): """Make the model object behave like a dict.""" return self.as_dict().items() def iteritems(self): """Make the model object behave like a dict.""" return self.as_dict().items() def keys(self): """Make the model object behave like a dict.""" return [key for key, value in self.iteritems()]

commit_message:
Put test-requirements into an extra named 'test'

In bindep files we use a 'test' environment to indicate dependencies
that are needed for testing. Make the same thing available for our
python dependencies, allowing things like "pip install .[test]" or "pip
install shade[test]" to work.

Change-Id: If3ad8b6a79a8cab2f7434b73207f35384e8516ba

commit_message:
Pin API version during rolling upgrade

During a rolling upgrade, when the new services are pinned to the
old release, the API version will also be pinned to the old release.
This will prevent users from accessing new features that may not quite
work.

The .sample was updated to reflect the change to the help string for
the [DEFAULT]/pin_release_version configuration option. The update also
pulled in changes for other options, from other (non-ironic) libraries.

Change-Id: I38a0f106b589945fb62071f3dfe5bff43c6fee93
Partial-Bug: #1708549

subject: OVN: Remove container-attribute-target=host from the ovn_dbs_bundle
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-04 11:15:53.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/pacemaker/ovn_dbs_bundle.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/f13555df656fd7f22e6516202ba4a4becd5943e2', 'message': "OVN: Remove container-attribute-target=host from the ovn_dbs_bundle

The commit with change id I0dd06e953b4c81f217d0f4199b2337e4c3358086 added the
meta param 'container-attribute-target=host' in the ovn-dbs-bundle resource.
Because of this the pacemaker is not promoting any node to master.

Looks like we have to address this issue in OVN OCF script [1]. But not setting
this param, also seems to work fine. So, not sure if we really need to do anything.

This patch removes this param.
[1] - https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/master/ovn/utilities/ovndb-servers.ocf
Change-Id: I4897e1b9ae9c6feef8db68b62124b2bdb5f65a5b
"}]
commit_message:
OVN: Remove container-attribute-target=host from the ovn_dbs_bundle

The commit with change id I0dd06e953b4c81f217d0f4199b2337e4c3358086 added the
meta param 'container-attribute-target=host' in the ovn-dbs-bundle resource.
Because of this the pacemaker is not promoting any node to master.

Looks like we have to address this issue in OVN OCF script [1]. But not setting
this param, also seems to work fine. So, not sure if we really need to do anything.

This patch removes this param.
[1] - https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/master/ovn/utilities/ovndb-servers.ocf
Change-Id: I4897e1b9ae9c6feef8db68b62124b2bdb5f65a5b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/57/525157/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # In the meta_params, setting 'container-attribute-target=host' is not working. # Pacemake is not promoting any node as master. # Looks like it needs to be addresses in the OVN OCF script [1]. Not setting this # param also seems to work fine. So not sure, if we really need to address this. # [1] - https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/master/ovn/utilities/ovndb-servers.ocf meta_params => 'notify=true',

subject: Add Selection objects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-30 17:31:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/bb0cdf04bd7ca3888f5191ec626d8173f715547b', 'message': "WIP - Add ${Destination} and ${Destination}List objects

NOTE: After creating this, I discovered that there is an object named
'Destination' in the RequestSpec, so we'll need to bikeshed on a
different name for these things. But as a POC I'm posting this, changing
every 'destination' to 'xdestination' as a placeholder until a better
name can be agreed upon.

The $Destination object incorporates the information returned from the
scheduler into an object that is cleaner to pass over RPC, and which
allows versioning of any changes to this data. The $DestinationList
object is an iterator, allowing the cell conductor to loop over its
destinations until it either succeeds with a build or runs out of
destinations.

Blueprint: return-destination-objects

Change-Id: Ic135752bcee73f8b5fc73a8df785c698c16ac324

commit_message:
Add Selection objects

The Selection object incorporates the information returned from the
scheduler into an object that is cleaner to pass over RPC, and which
allows versioning of any changes to this data.

Blueprint: return-alternate-hosts

Change-Id: Ic135752bcee73f8b5fc73a8df785c698c16ac324
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/39/499239/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: __import__('nova.objects.xdestination')

subject: Call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses on agent start
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-24 11:47:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/575ace88bedf6131449e5a8e56bb720b51c6c371', 'message': 'Call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses on agent start

As explained in bug [1] when l3 agent fails to report state to the
server, its state is set to AGENT_REVIVED, triggering
fetch_and_sync_all_routers, which will set all its HA network ports
to DOWN, resulting in
1) ovs agent rewiring these ports and setting status to ACTIVE
2) when these ports are active, server sends router update to l3 agent
As server, ovs and l3 agents are busy with this processing, l3 agent
may fail again reporting state, repeating this process.

As l3 agent is repeatedly processing same routers, SIGHUPs are
frequently sent to keepalived, resulting in multiple masters.

To fix this, we call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses in l3 agent
start instead of calling from fetch_and_sync_all_routers.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1731595/comments/7
Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
        neutron/api/rpc/handlers/l3_rpc.py

Change-Id: Ia9d5549f7d53b538c9c9f93fe6aa71ffff15524a
Related-bug: #1597461
Closes-Bug: #1731595
(cherry picked from commit 9ab1ad1433d54fec3e5b04f1edf8ca436e1f7af1)
(cherry picked from commit a6d985bbca57b5027eecaa43071964b14d9075d9)
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-24 14:41:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5d1ef941bbbac47f62e163e61417bb415b81717e', 'message': 'Call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses on agent start

To fix this, we call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses in l3 agent

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2017-12-01 06:41:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2636bd08809732707cc3095b4d2455385324e7e3', 'message': 'Call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses on agent start

server, its state is set to AGENT_REVIVED, triggering
fetch_and_sync_all_routers, which will set all its HA network ports
to DOWN, resulting in

2) when these ports are active, server sends router update to l3 agent
As server, ovs and l3 agents are busy with this processing, l3 agent

As l3 agent is repeatedly processing same routers, SIGHUPs are
frequently sent to keepalived, resulting in multiple masters.

To fix this, we call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses in l3 agent

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2017-12-04 13:22:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/147bf3b9ef7b149504f5c978524f87cc8355f74a', 'message': 'Call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses on agent start

As explained in bug [1] when l3 agent fails to report state to the
server, its state is set to AGENT_REVIVED, triggering
fetch_and_sync_all_routers, which will set all its HA network ports
to DOWN, resulting in
1) ovs agent rewiring these ports and setting status to ACTIVE
2) when these ports are active, server sends router update to l3 agent
As server, ovs and l3 agents are busy with this processing, l3 agent
may fail again reporting state, repeating this process.

As l3 agent is repeatedly processing same routers, SIGHUPs are
frequently sent to keepalived, resulting in multiple masters.

To fix this, we call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses in l3 agent
start instead of calling from fetch_and_sync_all_routers.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1731595/comments/7
Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
        neutron/api/rpc/handlers/l3_rpc.py

Note: This RPC update_all_ha_network_port_statuses is added in only pike
and later branches. In older branches, we were using get_router_ids RPC
to invoke _update_ha_network_port_status. As we need to invoke this
functionality during l3 agent start and get_service_plugin_list() is the
only available RPC which is called during l3 agent start, we call
_update_ha_network_port_status from get_service_plugin_list.

Change-Id: Ia9d5549f7d53b538c9c9f93fe6aa71ffff15524a
Related-bug: #1597461
Closes-Bug: #1731595

commit_message:
Call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses on agent start

As explained in bug [1] when l3 agent fails to report state to the
server, its state is set to AGENT_REVIVED, triggering
fetch_and_sync_all_routers, which will set all its HA network ports
to DOWN, resulting in
1) ovs agent rewiring these ports and setting status to ACTIVE
2) when these ports are active, server sends router update to l3 agent
As server, ovs and l3 agents are busy with this processing, l3 agent
may fail again reporting state, repeating this process.

As l3 agent is repeatedly processing same routers, SIGHUPs are
frequently sent to keepalived, resulting in multiple masters.

To fix this, we call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses in l3 agent
start instead of calling from fetch_and_sync_all_routers.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1731595/comments/7
Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
        neutron/api/rpc/handlers/l3_rpc.py

Note: This RPC update_all_ha_network_port_statuses is added in only pike
and later branches. In older branches, we were using get_router_ids RPC
to invoke _update_ha_network_port_status. As we need to invoke this
functionality during l3 agent start and get_service_plugin_list() is the
only available RPC which is called during l3 agent start, we call
_update_ha_network_port_status from get_service_plugin_list.

Change-Id: Ia9d5549f7d53b538c9c9f93fe6aa71ffff15524a
Related-bug: #1597461
Closes-Bug: #1731595
(cherry picked from commit 9ab1ad1433d54fec3e5b04f1edf8ca436e1f7af1)
(cherry picked from commit a6d985bbca57b5027eecaa43071964b14d9075d9)

added_lines: from neutron._i18n import _LI """Returns list of activated services. This will also update HA network port status to down for all HA routers hosted on <host>. This is needed to avoid l3 agent spawning keepalived when l2 agent not yet wired the port. This can happen after a system reboot that has wiped out flows, etc and the L2 agent hasn't started up yet. The port will still be ACTIVE in the data model and the L3 agent will use that info to mistakenly think that L2 network is ready. By forcing into DOWN, we will require the L2 agent to essentially ack that the port is indeed ACTIVE by reacting to the port update and calling update_device_up. """ host = kwargs.get('host') if host and utils.is_extension_supported( self.plugin, constants.PORT_BINDING_EXT_ALIAS): LOG.info(_LI("Host %s requested to set all it's HA network " "ports status to DOWN."), host) self._update_ha_network_port_status(context, host)

commit_message:
Just use 'import mock' for all mock versions

It's apparently not needed anymore to try to use the
various locations of mock depending on where it may exist,
so let's just stick to using it from the pypi library.

Change-Id: I4650ff0b19f09005d7f9d4b6184e2f7d3c9046bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/29/201929/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: from unittest import mock except ImportError: import mock
deleted_lines: # This is weird like this since we want to import a mock that works the best # and we need to try this import order, since oslotest registers a six.moves # module (but depending on the import order of importing oslotest we may or # may not see that change when trying to use it from six). try: from six.moves import mock except ImportError: try: # In python 3.3+ mock got included in the standard library... from unittest import mock except ImportError: import mock

subject: XenAPI: provide vGPU inventory in compute node
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-30 08:56:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/22313cfa0aa91fbb8d73f47f7211ee6651c0ecc2', 'message': 'XenAPI: provide vGPU inventory in compute node

This commit is to create inventory data for virtual GPU(vGPU)
basing on the host_stats reported by XenAPI. The final target
is to create child resource providers under the compute node
for each GPU group (XenAPI manages the same type of physical
GPU in one GPU group), so that we can associate traits to the
resource provider. Then users can consume vGPU from different
resourc providers(representing GPU groups) basing on specific
traits. But at the moment, the nested resource provider is still
in progress of development. So the decision is to firstly implement
a simple vGPU feature by including vGPU resource in compute node's
inventory.

As compute node is the only resource provider for the vGPUs, in
the resoure provider we can't determine which group the vGPUs belong
to. So we will treat all vGPU as the same.
For example, if one compute node has two types of GPUs: e.g.
"NVIDIA K1" which can supply 4 vGPUs with the type of "Grid K180Q";
and 'Intel Iris Pro Graphics P6300" which can supply 7 vGPUs with
the type of "Intel GVT-g". The total amount of the resource class
of "VGPU" in the inventory is 4 + 7 = 11.

Once we switch to use nestes resource providers, we can create
inventory under different child resource providers for each
GPU group. Then we can schedule resource providers basing on
traits.

Change-Id: Iba4fcb82dd18e8c1f22d0ce3358078c5263c77dc
blueprint: add-support-for-vgpu

the type of "Intel GVT-g". The total amount of the resource class
of "VGPU" in the inventory is 4 + 7 = 11.

Once we switch to use nested resource providers, we can create
inventory under different child resource providers for each
GPU group. Then we can schedule resource providers basing on
traits.

traits. But at the moment, the nested resource provider is still
in progress of development. So the decision is to firstly implement
a simple vGPU feature by including vGPU resource in compute node's
inventory.

As compute node is the only resource provider for the vGPUs, in
the resource provider we can't determine which group the vGPUs belong
to. So we will treat all vGPU as the same.
For example, if one compute node has two types of GPUs: e.g.
"NVIDIA K1" which can supply 4 vGPUs with the type of "Grid K180Q";
and 'Intel Iris Pro Graphics P6300" which can supply 7 vGPUs with
the type of "Intel GVT-g". The total amount of the resource class
of "VGPU" in the inventory is 4 + 7 = 11.

Once we switch to use nested resource providers, we can create
inventory under different child resource providers for each
GPU group. Then we can schedule resource providers basing on
traits.

Change-Id: Iba4fcb82dd18e8c1f22d0ce3358078c5263c77dc
blueprint: add-support-for-vgpu

commit_message:
XenAPI: provide vGPU inventory in compute node

This commit is to create inventory data for virtual GPU(vGPU)
basing on the host_stats reported by XenAPI. The final target
is to create child resource providers under the compute node
for each GPU group (XenAPI manages the same type of physical
GPU in one GPU group), so that we can support multiple GPUs which
have different traits. Then users can consume vGPU from different
resource providers(representing GPU groups) basing on specific
traits. But at the moment, the nested resource provider is still
in progress of development. So the decision is to firstly implement
a simple vGPU feature by including vGPU resource in compute node's
inventory.

Change-Id: Iba4fcb82dd18e8c1f22d0ce3358078c5263c77dc
blueprint: add-support-for-vgpu
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/17/516217/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_vgpu_total(self, vgpu_stats): # NOTE(jianghuaw): For the moment, the vGPU inventory is associated to # compute node. Before we switch to use the nested resource provider, # we cannot distinguish the vGPUs in different GPU group - each group # presents a type of physical GPU (e.g. "Nvidia K1", 'Intel Iris Pro # Graphics P6300" etc), as the traits which can be used to distinguish # them cannot be associated to inventory but can only be associated # to the resource provider. So we treat all vGPUs as just the same. # The total amount of the vGPU resources in the inventory is the sum # of the amount in all GPU groups. total = 0 for grp_id in vgpu_stats: total += vgpu_stats[grp_id]['total'] return total vgpus = self._get_vgpu_total(host_stats['vgpu_stats']) if vgpus > 0: # Only create inventory for vGPU when driver can supply vGPUs. # At the moment, XenAPI can support up to one vGPU per VM, # so max_unit is 1. result.update( { fields.ResourceClass.VGPU: { 'total': vgpus, 'min_unit': 1, 'max_unit': 1, 'step_size': 1, } } )

commit_message:
Add cluster-show to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the cluster-show command.

The trove command cluster-show is now:
    openstack database cluster show

Change-Id: I7021a0bf7fedaa5bbaa4979709b6a1de005b1db3
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Now OSC server create check keys in --nic

Now OSC command to create server will check all the keys in --nic
and throws an exception if the key is invalid key.

Change-Id: I5482da0ae63d6d4298aa614e4d09bb0547da9ec3
Closes-Bug: #1681411
(cherry picked from commit fcafd987b0143a08eff964f1e988a3aaa40ad824)

commit_message:
Ceilometer mitaka-eol

Change the test-requirements to use the mitaka-eol branch, as
the stable/mitaka branch no longer exists in Ceilometer.
Also limit the oslotest to < 2.0.0 to avoid a mockpatch issue
in ceilometer's db.py unit test.

Also capping the monasca-client to avoid picking up Pike version.

This echos the change made to master branch in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/518414/

Change-Id: I3781dace1dfc64467ab059742133cd189276a3e2

commit_message:
Add backup-show to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the backup-show command.

The trove command backup-show is now:
    openstack database backup show

Change-Id: I2f8a4c9c9df1ca68c5746acd272e80d7d9eda364
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-troveclient refs/changes/97/524097/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import sixdef set_attributes_for_print_detail(backup): info = backup._info.copy() if hasattr(backup, 'datastore'): info['datastore'] = backup.datastore['type'] info['datastore_version'] = backup.datastore['version'] info['datastore_version_id'] = backup.datastore['version_id'] return info class ShowDatabaseBackup(command.ShowOne): _description = _("Shows details of a database backup") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ShowDatabaseBackup, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'backup', metavar='<backup>', help=_('ID or name of the backup'), ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): database_backups = self.app.client_manager.database.backups backup = osc_utils.find_resource(database_backups, parsed_args.backup) backup = set_attributes_for_print_detail(backup) return zip(*sorted(six.iteritems(backup)))

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-06 07:08:19.000000000', 'files': ['specs/queens/approved/zone-migration-strategy.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/watcher-specs/commit/f2d2bd0bc0ff13a62c167b4d603711a5a998b9c4', 'message': 'Update zone migration strategy spec

* Update efficacy indicators and specs.

commit_message:
Update zone migration strategy spec

* Update efficacy indicators and specs.

  Because audit can not know actual number of instances migrated in
  previous audits, this patch updates LiveInstanceMigrateCount
  means the number of instances should be live migrated in each
  audit. live_instance_migrate_ratio is also updated to
  PlannedLiveInstanceMigrateCount / LiveInstanceMigrateCount.
  Cold migration, volume migration, and volume update were also
  updated as the same way.

* Update how to prioritize instances and volumes.

  The strategy chooses instances in descending order of one of the
  list. To choosing volumes is also updated as the same manner.

* Remove changing migration parallel number by network workload.

  The number of actions to be run in parallel per node or pool is
  given by the input parameter and not vary from now on.

Change-Id: I740e13ec235d80b55f38582906132a01b90387a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher-specs refs/changes/15/525915/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The number of instances should be live migrated The number of instances should be cold migrated The number of detached volumes should be migrated The number of attached volumes should be updated The number of attached volumes planned to update Ratio of planned live migrate instances to instances should be live migrated. The result of PlannedLiveInstanceMigrateCount / LiveInstanceMigrateCount Ratio of planned cold migrate instances to instances should be cold migrated. The result of PlannedColdInstanceMigrateCount / ColdInstanceMigrateCount Ratio of planned detached volumes to volumes should be migrated. so the resource_cleanup can be removed.

commit_message:
Enable octavia certificate configuration

This change enables configuration of certificate based properties in
Octavia for setting up secure communication with amphorae.

Change-Id: I164da1228397f9a900118cae377b55f79c4fadaf

commit_message:
Add datastore-show to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the datastore-show command.

The trove command datastore-show is now:
    openstack datastore show

Change-Id: I126493627d6b7fdf60e5d605dd64cfb3fbead10e
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-troveclient refs/changes/50/524150/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: datastore_show = troveclient.osc.v1.datastores:ShowDatastore

self.assertEqual(volume_data['snapshot_id'], snapshot['id']) class TestCinderVolumeIsolatedAdmin( base.BaseApplicationCatalogScenarioIsolatedAdminTest): @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): if not application_name = utils.generate_name('VM') cls.abs_archive_path, dir_with_archive, archive_name = \ utils.prepare_package( application_name, app='io.murano.apps.test.VM', manifest_required=False) if CONF.application_catalog.glare_backend: cls.client = cls.artifacts_client else: cls.client = cls.application_catalog_client cls.package = cls.client.upload_package( application_name, archive_name, dir_with_archive, {"categories": ["Web"], "tags": ["test"]}) cls.volume = cls.create_volume(size='1') @classmethod def resource_cleanup(cls): cls.delete_volume(cls.volume['id']) cls.client.delete_package(cls.package['id']) os.remove(cls.abs_archive_path) super(TestCinderVolumeIsolatedAdmin, cls).resource_cleanup() @decorators.idempotent_id('4111eb94-2636-4d0b-af5c-776ed5a59b87') @testtools.testcase.attr('smoke') @testtools.testcase.attr('scenario') def test_deploy_app_with_volume_creation_readonly(self): """Test app deploy with volume creation with readonly Scenario: 1. Create environment 2. Add VM application with ability to create and attach Cinder volume with size 1 GiB and readonly properties to the instance 3. Deploy environment 4. Make sure that deployment finished successfully 5. Check that application is accessible 6. Check that volume is attached to the instance, has size 1GiB, and readonly attributes 7. Delete environment """ name = utils.generate_name('testMurano') environment = self.application_catalog_client.\ create_environment(name) self.addCleanup(self.environment_delete, environment['id']) session = self.application_catalog_client.\ create_session(environment['id']) volume_attributes = { "/dev/vdb": { "?": { "type": "io.murano.resources.CinderVolume" }, "size": 1, "readOnly": True } } post_body = self.vm_cinder(attributes=volume_attributes) self.application_catalog_client.\ create_service(environment['id'], session['id'], post_body) self.deploy_environment(environment, session) volume_data = self.get_volume(environment['id']) self.check_volume_attached('testMurano', volume_data['id']) self.assertEqual(volume_data['size'], 1) self.assertEqual(volume_data['metadata']['readonly'], 'True') @decorators.idempotent_id('5c134343-11bc-4329-ac30-9b43f32c15e2') @testtools.testcase.attr('smoke') @testtools.testcase.attr('scenario') def test_deploy_app_with_volume_creation_from_backup(self): """Test app deployment with volume creation from volume backup Scenario: 1. Make backup from volume 2. Create environment 3. Add VM application with ability to create Cinder volume with size 1 GiB from existing volume backup and attach it to the instance 4. Deploy environment 5. Make sure that deployment finished successfully 6. Check that application is accessible 7. Check that volume is attached to the instance, has size 1GiB and restored from existing volume backup 8. Delete environment, backup """ if not (CONF.volume_feature_enabled.backup and CONF.service_available.swift): msg = ("Cinder backup driver and Swift are required. " "Deploy app with volume restoring from backup test " "will be skipped.") raise self.skipException(msg) backup = self.create_backup(self.volume['id']) self.addCleanup(self.delete_backup, backup['id']) name = utils.generate_name('testMurano') environment = self.application_catalog_client. \ create_environment(name) self.addCleanup(self.environment_delete, environment['id']) session = self.application_catalog_client. \ create_session(environment['id']) volume_attributes = { "/dev/vdb": { "?": { "type": "io.murano.resources.CinderVolume" }, "size": 1, "name": "restore_backup_" + backup['id'], "sourceVolumeBackup": { "?": { "type": "io.murano.resources.CinderVolumeBackup" }, "openstackId": backup['id'] } } } post_body = self.vm_cinder(volume_attributes) self.application_catalog_client. \ create_service(environment['id'], session['id'], post_body) self.deploy_environment(environment, session) volume_data = self.get_volume(environment['id']) self.check_volume_attached('testMurano', volume_data['id']) self.assertEqual(volume_data['size'], 1) self.assertIn(backup['id'], volume_data['name'])

commit_message:
Enable the ansible deploy interface out of box

This new deploy interface works by SSHing into IPA and using ansible to
orchestrate all deployment actions.

Change-Id: Ic697d50710a9ad92f70386b8dd74019e8cd5320b
Implements: blueprint ansible-deploy

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-02 18:26:28.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud/commit/b38669cb2e9361bdf8536bd99594673bf2d95eab', 'message': "Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: I86415b6de6725f3fac361b5dbf9414ccb12e17f9
"}]
commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: I86415b6de6725f3fac361b5dbf9414ccb12e17f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/92/524892/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_command = pip install {opts} {packages}

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-27 21:03:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/df70fba6e0b385795d200caa7a105cab25b6a77f', 'message': "Don't assume single sub_node in nic config

This nic config only works when there is one sub_node since we were
cat'ing /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes_private expecting to get a single IP
back. Instead, cat /etc/nodepool/node_private which will be the IP
address of the given sub_node.

Change-Id: I4958170b77838ea57c8f27531f70bf8d7a44302e
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-27 21:05:34.000000000', 'files': ['ci/common/net-config-multinode-os-net-config.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/86608ee51af46cf6c56ed50b616b9014e90e61e7', 'message': "Don't assume single sub_node in nic config

This nic config only works when there is one sub_node since we were
cat'ing /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes_private expecting to get a single IP
back. Instead, cat /etc/nodepool/node_private which will be the IP
address of the given sub_node.

Change-Id: I4958170b77838ea57c8f27531f70bf8d7a44302e
"}]
commit_message:
Don't assume single sub_node in nic config

This nic config only works when there is one sub_node since we were
cat'ing /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes_private expecting to get a single IP
back. Instead, cat /etc/nodepool/node_private which will be the IP
address of the given sub_node.

Change-Id: I4958170b77838ea57c8f27531f70bf8d7a44302e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/27/523227/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: subnode_index=$(grep -n $(cat /etc/nodepool/node_private) /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes_private | cut -d: -f1)

commit_message:
Users can only edit users with full permission

* A user should only be able to edit a user when they have
  permission accross all of that users roles.

Change-Id: Ia69a40f6113ee36c0d3c58281a729f3390d69a86
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/adjutant refs/changes/54/526254/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'User missing roles.') def _validate_role_permissions(self): id_manager = user_store.IdentityManager() current_user_roles = id_manager.get_roles(project=self.project_id, user=self.user_id) current_user_roles = [role.name for role in current_user_roles] current_roles_manageable = self.are_roles_managable( self.action.task.keystone_user['roles'], current_user_roles) all_roles = set() all_roles.update(self.roles) all_roles.update(self.inherited_roles) new_roles_manageable = self.are_roles_managable( self.action.task.keystone_user['roles'], all_roles) return new_roles_manageable and current_roles_manageable

commit_message:
Docs: Updated developer documentation to use -infra repo

This PS updates the developer documentation to make use
of the openstack-helm-infra repo and new developer
environment.

Implements: blueprint developer-environment

Change-Id: I45b627f78b9504dc0abfbe7d0061ea3475ee4748
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/73/523173/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This guide covers the minimum number of requirements to get started.Install the latest versions of Git, CA Certs & Make if necessary sudo apt-get install --no-install-recommends \ ca-certificates \Clone the OpenStack-Helm-Infra Repo ----------------------------------- git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra.git cd openstack-helm-infra Deploy Kubernetes & Helm ------------------------ You may now deploy kubernetes, and helm onto your machine: make dev-deploy k8s This command will deploy a single node KubeADM administered cluster. This will use the paramiters in ``tools/gate/playbooks/vars.yaml`` to control the deployment, which can be over-ridden by adding entries to ``tools/gate/devel/local-vars.yaml``. Once a kubernetes cluster is running we can progress with the deployment. Using git, clone the repository that holds all of the OpenStack service charts.
deleted_lines: This guide covers the minimum number of requirements to get started. For most users, the main prerequisites are to install the most recent versions of Kubectl and Helm. Setup etc/hosts --------------- :: HOST_IFACE=$(ip route | grep "^default" | head -1 | awk '{ print $5 }') LOCAL_IP=$(ip addr | awk "/inet/ && /${HOST_IFACE}/{sub(/\/.*$/,\"\",\$2); print \$2}") cat << EOF | sudo tee -a /etc/hosts ${LOCAL_IP} $(hostname) EOFInstall the latest versions of Docker, Network File System, Git, Make & Curl if necessary sudo apt-get install --no-install-recommends -qq \ curl \ docker.io \ nfs-common \Kubectl ------- Download and install kubectl, the command line interface for running commands against your Kubernetes cluster. export KUBE_VERSION=v1.7.5 export HELM_VERSION=v2.6.1 export TMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d) curl -sSL https://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-release/release/${KUBE_VERSION}/bin/linux/amd64/kubectl -o ${TMP_DIR}/kubectl chmod +x ${TMP_DIR}/kubectl sudo mv ${TMP_DIR}/kubectl /usr/local/bin/kubectl Helm ---- Download and install Helm, the package manager for Kubernetes curl -sSL https://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-helm/helm-${HELM_VERSION}-linux-amd64.tar.gz | tar -zxv --strip-components=1 -C ${TMP_DIR} sudo mv ${TMP_DIR}/helm /usr/local/bin/helm rm -rf ${TMP_DIR}Using git, clone the repository that holds all of the OpenStack service charts.Setup Helm client ----------------- Initialize the helm client and start listening on localhost:8879. Once the helm client is available, add the local repository to the helm client. Use ``helm [command] --help`` for more information about the Helm commands. :: helm init --client-only helm serve & helm repo add local http://localhost:8879/charts helm repo remove stable

commit_message:
Bump Max version to 3.46

Bump max version in client directly as
the client changes are not needed.

1. 3.46: support create bootable volume from nova
         0 size image.

Change-Id: Ib0cf2d88e55006c10b873327ccc85dca2dd09769

commit_message:
Selectively disable token caching

* Token caching can cause errors when a user is removed from a
  project when they have a still valid token for it.
* Default was to cache for 5 minutes
* This adds a setting in the conf file that will set the cache
  time.
* -1 Disables the cache

Change-Id: I70b05f6a09b195dd87452689eb6e211d812fc8c8
Closes-Bug:1736304

commit_message:
Remove member role assignment

"add_user_to_project" and "remove_user_from_project" are only
used for V2. This patch removed these two useless functions.

Change-Id: I94f7573997035c4395ec77eabe0d6e45ff9c3bf7

commit_message:
Link to tasks panel in notifications

* Adjutant-UI now supports views for Tasks, we should link to
  it in the default notification templates.
* To make this possible, and other potential uses, deprecate
  the TOKEN_SUBMISSION_URL in favor of HORIZON_URL
* clean up some formatting issues with the notification template

Change-Id: I1419fafe94812e64a0b3984f9f38528ec67ac8e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/adjutant refs/changes/57/508057/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if settings.HORIZON_URL: task_url = settings.HORIZON_URL if not task_url.endswith('/'): task_url += '/' task_url += 'management/tasks/' context['task_url'] = task_url

commit_message:
Add retry logic mechanism

Added retry logic mechanism and added them to the API calls
where ironic presently attempts to pull an exclusive
lock on the baremetal node.

Change-Id: Ia6fbc9eec612793b3214d7883e0552913a088d5d

commit_message:
Change assert(Not)Equals to assert(Not)Equal

According to http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html
assert(Not)Equals is a deprecated alias of assert(Not)Equal.

Change-Id: If552f49edaeb3e3c387e47aa62add902c6fa6c52
Closes-Bug: #1329757

commit_message:
QNAP: Add support for QES 1.1.4

This patch do the following changes to the QNAP Manila driver:
1. Add support for QNAP QES firmware 1.1.4.
2. Correct the default parameters in edit share function.
2. Remove unused code flow.
4. Add more debug log and write more test cases.

    Implements: blueprint support-qes-114

Change-Id: I977ef3e66a21a52116b44059ad5aeaf1560b47b7

commit_message:
Do not send email when logs are not available

As per request, do not send email when there's no logs available,
since it's useless.

commit_message:
Move remove_uwsgi_config to cleanup_placement

It had been in stop_placement, but we don't want it there: the old
side of grenade needs to call that but should not remove the uwsgi
configuration when doing so. It is configuration, after all.

Change-Id: Iee763adf7895145d97b184924896db3f1f48a015
Partial-Bug: #1736385

commit_message:
ACTIVE-ACTIVE: Initial distributor driver

This patch is the initial implementation of a distributor driver for
Octavia Active/Active topology support.

This patch is a decompostion of the following patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/313006

Story: 2001288
Task: 5836

Depends-On: I97b52b80efb33749647229a55147a08afa112dd2
Change-Id: I65e4a533caee692e1c98e8c6586c2e2132f2e34c
Co-Authored-By: Valeria Perelman <perelman@il.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Move remove_uwsgi_config to cleanup_placement

It had been in stop_placement, but we don't want it there: the old
side of grenade needs to call that but should not remove the uwsgi
configuration when doing so. It is configuration, after all.

Change-Id: Iee763adf7895145d97b184924896db3f1f48a015
Partial-Bug: #1736385
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/89/525789/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support list with 'with_count' in client

Add 'with_count' parameter in list
volume, snapshot and backup APIs.

Change-Id: I2b7b41b3579c24703a7a67ab5dc6f960a3ccbdc2
Partial-Implements: bp add-amount-info-in-list-api
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/20/525120/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_list_with_with_count(self): self.run_command('--os-volume-api-version 3.45 list --with-count') self.assert_called('GET', '/volumes/detail?with_count=True') def test_backup_list_with_with_count(self): self.run_command( '--os-volume-api-version 3.45 backup-list --with-count') self.assert_called('GET', '/backups/detail?with_count=True') def test_snapshot_list_with_with_count(self): self.run_command( '--os-volume-api-version 3.45 snapshot-list --with-count') self.assert_called('GET', '/snapshots/detail?with_count=True')

commit_message:
Improve function execution performance

- Improve/Simplify python runtime
- Use non-locking for communication with db when invoking function.
- Add config option to run job handler.
- Pre-fetch runtime when query function in db.

Change-Id: I9e791aecf03d5bf64a39548e6c9bad1b678882af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qinling refs/changes/26/525526/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We want to get runtime info when we query function runtime = relationship( 'Runtime', back_populates="functions", innerjoin=True, lazy='joined' )

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-06 21:40:33.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox-log-command.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/1f1b9faacbd9c2de3b9c896752280c08e9d86f74', 'message': 'fix command handling in tox-log-command.sh

commit_message:
fix command handling in tox-log-command.sh

Exit with an error if the pipeline produces an error and run the correct
command rather than the part of the command name used for the output
filename.

Change-Id: I0754ab219983cad3eb8dae327a5435d094f8cf85
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/09/526209/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Fail if any part of the pipe fails. set -o pipefail $@ 2>&1 | tee "$logfile"

commit_message:
monasca-api: Exclude stable/ocata from sphinx doc creation

Monasca-api didn't move to sphinx document creation until Pike.
To allow an exception for stable/ocata builds, remove the
publish-openstack-sphinx-docs template and put in equivalent
job listings, with branches: lines to exclude stable/ocata.

This can be reverted once Ocata reaches EOL.

Change-Id: I862d90aec2a94c6939ccc6823a854b68981b8adb

commit_message:
Remove default for --overcloud-ssh-key

The default value for --overcloud-ssh-key was wrong (it was actually a
username). Instead of using a default value at all, just remove the
default since we can't sanely pick one.

Change-Id: I57a7293f0cc08b0fab0ee7c2f0b4c0a8b2bd2f44
Closes-Bug: #1736606

commit_message:
Fix wrong path in ssh selinux issue detection.

I also make sure that if grep fail it doesn't make the whole
installation fails.

Change-Id: Ib5873383632a1141c8dd3859b34ca29904020790
Closes-Bug: #1736246

commit_message:
Allow running toci_gate_test on pre-provisioned ovb env

Currently we can only run toci_gate_test on an ovb environment
by using a tebroker. This is problematic if we want to reproduce
jobs exactly (modulo provisioning the environment).

This patch adds the ability to use a pre-provisioned OVB
environment to run the toci_gate_test script against.

Change-Id: I3256838cb636de6fe1e87fd08784b087abba89e2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/48/518748/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add IPSEC composable service

This service is tied to the external_deploy_tasks (such as the k8s
service); and it deploys IPSEC in the overcloud.

bp ipsec

Change-Id: Ie3b7af92c0ec97241de6d8badec13b9e93ee9305

subject: Fix swiftclient creation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-21 15:01:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/a205f8cb4ba0b9a8ff0835da3ffa6b29c5d2e9e8', 'message': 'Fix swiftclient creation

somewhere along the way we lost most of swiftclient options in a belief
that those are handled by the keystoneauth session passes to
swiftclient.

In fact though, swiftclient only uses the session to get itself an
endpoint and a token, but is has no SessionClient, and does not use that
passed in session to make further requests to swift itself.

This patch restores all the logic that we had to decompose the session
object loaded from config to options that are passed to swiftclient
explicitly.

Change-Id: I08f382aa9d2ad22f7dbd65f7b54a8dd0a765ba44
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-21 15:01:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/4b80e9ade51fbcd698ab8f5d46331b10c7a2a4b7', 'message': 'Fix swiftclient creation

somewhere along the way we lost most of swiftclient options in a belief
that those are handled by the keystoneauth session passes to
swiftclient.

In fact though, swiftclient only uses the session to get itself an
endpoint and a token, but is has no SessionClient, and does not use that
passed in session to make further requests to swift itself.

This patch restores all the logic that we had to decompose the session
object loaded from config to options that are passed to swiftclient
explicitly.

Change-Id: I08f382aa9d2ad22f7dbd65f7b54a8dd0a765ba44
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-06-21 16:59:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/04c623499a49be5209b8e38efcb539ebafe23edc', 'message': 'Fix swiftclient creation

somewhere along the way we lost most of swiftclient options in a belief
that those are handled by the keystoneauth session passes to
swiftclient.

In fact though, swiftclient only uses the session to get itself an
endpoint and a token, but is has no SessionClient, and does not use that
passed in session to make further requests to swift itself.

This patch restores all the logic that we had to decompose the session
object loaded from config to options that are passed to swiftclient
explicitly.

Change-Id: I08f382aa9d2ad22f7dbd65f7b54a8dd0a765ba44

commit_message:
Fix swiftclient creation

in the change I52f1386df45ebe0a43b11fe1583e012dfa3af532
we lost most of swiftclient options in a belief that those are handled
by the keystoneauth session passed to the swiftclient.

In fact though, swiftclient only uses this session to get itself an
endpoint and a token, but it has no SessionClient, and does not use that
passed in session to make further requests to swift itself.

This patch restores all the logic that we had to decompose the session
object loaded from config to options that are passed to swiftclient
explicitly.

Change-Id: I08f382aa9d2ad22f7dbd65f7b54a8dd0a765ba44
Partial-Bug: #1699547
Closes-Bug: #1736158
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/73/476173/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six params = {'retries': CONF.swift.swift_max_retries} # NOTE(pas-ha) swiftclient still (as of 3.3.0) does not use # (adapter-based) SessionClient, and uses the passed in session # only to resolve endpoint and get a token, # but not to make further requests to Swift itself. # Thus we need to deconstruct back all the adapter- and # session-related args as loaded by keystoneauth from config # to pass them to the client explicitly. # TODO(pas-ha) re-write this when swiftclient is brought on par # with other OS clients re auth plugins, sessions and adapters # support. session = _get_swift_session() params = {'session': session} adapter = keystone.get_adapter('swift', session=session) params['os_options'] = { 'service_type': adapter.service_type} if adapter.interface: params['os_options']['endpoint_type'] = adapter.interface if adapter.endpoint_override: params['os_options'][ 'object_storage_url'] = adapter.endpoint_override # deconstruct back session-related options params['timeout'] = session.timeout if session.verify is False: params['insecure'] = True elif isinstance(session.verify, six.string_types): params['cacert'] = session.verify if session.cert: # NOTE(pas-ha) although setting cert as path to single file # with both client cert and key is supported by Session, # keystoneauth loading always sets the session.cert # as tuple of cert and key. params['cert'], params['cert_key'] = session.cert

subject: undercloud: enable ansible deploy method by default

commit_message:
Introduce tripleo-bootstrap Ansible role

This role will be used to prepare an environment that will deploy
TripleO.
For now, it'll just deploy 2 packages by default.

Change-Id: I560273be2ebe3a49ff37e3682222706939e5d879

commit_message:
Update the Docker registry defaults to rdoproject

The rdoproject registry should be used by default.
The upstream release files are updated in the
depends-on review to use the Docker defaults.

Related-Bug: 1732477
Depends-On: I363a0fa5742a02d267a93bc5db1dc72a4b2fe414
Change-Id: I35607572fcf4bf3e53ed15ceb1c624053b5a7572

commit_message:
Improve message information for translation

Some error messages aren't fully compatible for a
translation in an other language.
This patch change few messages to allow a better translation.

Change-Id: Iab3d470133f500eb9e9daa5996ca54c6b36be5e3

commit_message:
Update cinder-new-attach-apis spec for begin_detaching

The question of how the begin_detaching call is going to
be used for new style attachments and the volume detach
flow came up in I91b9a60268354ffbed86b1e7d173906cfd7b97bd.

While not required for this blueprint, we wanted to capture
the outcome of the discussion for when we eventually support
volume multiattach.

Related to blueprint cinder-new-attach-apis

Change-Id: I6bf5cefa6be0d8fba4589d18e662b5180483fae4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/34/459134/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * We can most likely remove the ``nova.volume.cinder.API.check_detach`` method since performs state validation on the volume that is also checked in Cinder when we call ``begin_detaching``, and we should have Cinder perform the atomic state validation checks since it is the source of truth. * The ``begin_detaching`` API in Cinder is currently scoped only to the volume but we will likely need a similar API for volume attachments. To help illustrate this, consider that we have a volume with multiple attachments to server instances. If ``begin_detaching`` is called on the volume, its state will change from `in-use` to `detaching`. Once ``os-detach`` is called on the volume it will put the volume status back into `in-use` state because of the remaining attachment. This is a confusing state transition for the caller. Therefore we will likely need a ``begin_detaching`` method for attachments. That way if we have multiple attachments, the state transitions will work like this: 1. begin_detaching(attachment1): volume status is still `in-use` because attachment2 is `attached` status; compute deletes attachment1, volume status is unchanged (remains `in-use`). 2. begin_detaching(attachment2): volume status changes to `detaching` since the last attachment is now `detaching`; compute deletes attachment2, volume status changes to `available`. With this flow the caller only sees the volume state change from `in-use` to `detaching` to `available` even if there were multiple attachments at one point.

commit_message:
DNM: Run test_volume_backed_live_migration and iscsi test

Depends on a Tempest change to unskip the
test_volume_backed_live_migration test.

Change-Id: I375e671ea426db3106f664676be98c0e7d7a58ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/63/508163/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We test with libvirt 2.5.0 on xenial nodes so we can test live block # migration with an attached volume. echo 'enabling block_migration with an iscsi attached volume in tempest' $ANSIBLE primary --sudo -f 5 -i "$WORKSPACE/inventory" -m ini_file -a "dest=$BASE/new/tempest/etc/tempest.conf section=compute-feature-enabled option=block_migration_for_live_migration value=True" $ANSIBLE primary --sudo -f 5 -i "$WORKSPACE/inventory" -m ini_file -a "dest=$BASE/new/tempest/etc/tempest.conf section=compute-feature-enabled option=block_migrate_cinder_iscsi value=True" run_tempest "block migration test" "live_migration"
deleted_lines: echo 'NOTE: test_volume_backed_live_migration is skipped due to https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1524898' run_tempest "block migration test" "^.*test_live_migration(?!.*(test_volume_backed_live_migration))"

commit_message:
Bump roles SHA

This patch updates the keystone role to its latest available stable SHA.

This update is done out of the release cycle to pull down stability
fixes within the roles. The change is required to ensure we're
not being faced with pyldap breakage when building dependencies.

Change-Id: I5b9067c184bcfffe9f0588a5c4084316dd8b6d4f

Regular users can't check whether /proc/$CONTAINER_PID/root exist

using 'sudo'

Change-Id: I95997b697f85a223d22b1d0a5ad2b6237193fb89
"}]
commit_message:
test-log-collect.sh: Use sudo to check container's root directory

Regular users can't check whether /proc/$CONTAINER_PID/root exist
since it's normally only accessible by root so run the test command
using 'sudo'

Change-Id: I95997b697f85a223d22b1d0a5ad2b6237193fb89

commit_message:
SUSE: Drop OBS repositories for openSUSE Leap < 42.3

We were installing additional repos for the apt-cacher-ng and
liberasurecode packages which are only necessary for Leap < 42.3.
However, < 42.3 is now EOL so lets drop these repositories since we
can fetch these packages from the default repos in 42.3

Change-Id: I4ba16ea660907c3fb481a9e80d73b750c2f4c138
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_server refs/changes/00/526100/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: zypper_repositories: # NOTE(hwoarang): apt-cacher-ng and liberasurecode do not exist for # Leap < 42.3 so we need to grab them directly from the devel repo. # Remove this when support for Leap < 42.3 is gone - name: "OBS:Server:Proxy" repo: http://download.opensuse.org/repositories/server:/proxy/openSUSE_Leap_{{ ansible_distribution_version }} - name: "OBS:devel:libraries:c_c++" repo: http://download.opensuse.org/repositories/devel:/libraries:/c_c++/openSUSE_Leap_{{ ansible_distribution_version }}/

commit_message:
Add example for using external resources

Add template for show cases that how we can use external resources.
external resources in stack does not required to be modified or depends
on the stack.
blueprint external-resources

Depends-On: I8b33c957a7185a0f52356f412b13609ba1a7b469
Change-Id: Ia56318508caf43a7da28bd479becdc602477cad5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-templates refs/changes/94/417594/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: heat_template_version: newton description: > This template shows use case for external resource. Binding exists server to exists lbaas pool as new member. parameters: external_server_id: type: string description: ID of external server. constraints: - custom_constraint: nova.server external_pool_id: type: string description: External pool to contact constraints: - custom_constraint: neutron.lbaas.pool resources: external_pool: type: OS::Neutron::LBaaS::Pool external_id: {get_param: external_pool_id} external_server: type: OS::Nova::Server external_id: {get_param: exist_server_id} member: type: OS::Neutron::PoolMember properties: pool_id: {get_param: pool_id} address: {get_attr: [external_server, first_address]} protocol_port: 80 outputs: updated_member_list: description: LB members list. value: {get_attr: [external_pool, members]} lb_member: description: LB member details. value: {get_attr: [member, show]}

commit_message:
Add fixed_key parameter under key_manager section in cinder conf

This change is necessary for uploading an encrypted volume to glance.

Change-Id: I0975fc0c49ec243025d076f0406e28c4f5522d3a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/22/499022/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $CINDER_CONF key_manager fixed_key $(openssl rand -hex 16)

commit_message:
Complement Octavia client with a set of features

* Commands added: loadbalancer failover, loadbalancer amphora.
* Allow to filter 'list' calls.
e.g. list all pools that correspond with a given loadbalancer ID.
* Rename API internally, from load_balancer_v2 to Octavia.

Task: 5742
Story: 2001224

Change-Id: I7c38471073d8990de054def3d1d99f2c0524c26e

This commit advances the os_keystone SHA to consume a fix for LP#1736241.
Prior to this commit, Newton builds failed during the repo build with:

Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement pyasn1>=0.3.7 (from
python-ldap) (from versions: 0.1.9) No matching distribution found for

Change-Id: I2bf20796405cd9c841df4ebc610484ff3cb8ab4e
Closes-bug: #1736789
'}]
commit_message:
Bump os_keystone SHA to avoid repo build failures

This commit advances the os_keystone SHA to consume a fix for LP#1736241.
Prior to this commit, Newton builds failed during the repo build with:

Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement pyasn1>=0.3.7 (from
python-ldap) (from versions: 0.1.9) No matching distribution found for
pyasn1>=0.3.7 (from python-ldap)

Change-Id: I2bf20796405cd9c841df4ebc610484ff3cb8ab4e
Closes-bug: #1736789

Move policy into code

This commit registers default policies in code. For the
Register and Document Policy in Code community goal.

bp policy-and-docs-in-code

Closes-Bug: 1724714

zuul: add irrelevant-files section to job

This adds the 'irrelevant-files' section to the job
networking-generic-switch-tempest-dsvm-dlm. If all the
changes are in this list, the job is not run.

commit_message:
tasks: repo_build_install: Drop 'force' argument from zypper

We are not switching package vendors anymore so we should drop the
'force' argument from zypper.

Change-Id: I89093c2e8d10b5b5355728e7507d70fd01844ea5

commit_message:
Simplify the way drivers report support for ipv6

Driver shouldn't have to report support for ipv6 in two
places. Drivers that assert ipv6_implemented=True just
need to implement get_configured_ip_versions. Likewise
ipv4 support is computed by the same method.

Closes-bug: #1734127

Change-Id: I382767918a65b91e99ac1e604304ad01fac332e6
